original: ji ltar gnas par gyur pa'i kha dog la ring po la sogs par ming 'dogs par zad do zhes ma bshad dam /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas par gyur pa'i kha dog la ring po la sogs par ming 'dogs par zad do zhes ma bshad dam /

original: dper na grog ma la sogs pa @168b tha mi dad bzhin du 'khor lo la sogs pa tha dad par 'dogs pa ltar dbyibs kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na grog ma la sogs pa @168b tha mi dad bzhin du 'khor lo la sogs pa tha dad par 'dogs pa ltar dbyibs kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, the wheel, etc. is designated as different, although the ants, etc. are not different.

original: 'o na gang mun khung dang thag ring po nas sdong dum la sogs pa'i kha dog ma mthong bar ring po la sogs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang mun khung dang thag ring po nas sdong dum la sogs pa'i kha dog ma mthong bar ring po la sogs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: de dag gi de kha dog mi gsal ba kho na mthong nas ring po la sogs par yongs su rtog par byed de /

analyzed: phreng ba dang dmag la sogs pa la yongs su rtog pa bzhin no //

original: de ni gdon mi za bar de ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar de ltar shes par bya ste /

original: gang res 'ga' yongs su chad pa nges par mi zin pa ni tshogs pa tsam dang mi gsal ba snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gang res 'ga' yongs su chad pa nges par mi zin pa ni tshogs pa tsam dang mi gsal ba snang ba yin no //

original: de dag ni dbyibs kho na la lus kyis rnam par rig byed 'dogs par byed la rdzas su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dbyibs kho na la lus kyis rnam par rig byed 'dogs par byed la rdzas su ni ma yin no //

original: de la 'dogs par byed pa na ji ltar lus kyi las su 'dogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la 'dogs par byed pa na ji ltar lus kyi las su 'dogs par byed ce na /

original: lus la brten pa'i las ni lus kyi las te /
analyzed: lus la brten pa'i las ni lus kyi las te /

analyzed: 'o na gang sems pa dang / bsam pa'i las so zhes gsungs so zhe na /

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam pa'i kun du rtog pa ni sngar 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam pa'i kun du rtog pa ni sngar 'byung la /

analyzed: de ltar bsams nas de'i 'og tu gang gis lus 'jug par byed par bya ba'i sems pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: After reflecting in this way, the intention that engages the body arises.

original: de ni bsam pa'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bsam pa'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the action of intention.

original: de ltan na 'o na rnam par rig byed med pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang med bas nyes pa chen por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltan na 'o na rnam par rig byed med pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang med bas nyes pa chen por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If this is so, then since there is no informative form in the desire realm, nonindicative form would not exist there, and this would lead to the great fault that the desire realm would be devoid of action and its result.

original: thal ba rnams la yang thal ba'i gnyen po dag yod de /
analyzed: thal ba rnams la yang thal ba'i gnyen po dag yod de /
translated: But there is a response to this consequence.

original: gal te lus kyi las zhes bya ba'i sems pa'i khyad par de nyid las rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung bar 'gyur na yang cir 'gyur mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bzhin du sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin par 'gyur
analyzed: gal te lus kyi las zhes bya ba'i sems pa'i khyad par de nyid las rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung bar 'gyur na yang cir 'gyur mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bzhin du sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin par 'gyur
translated: If nonindicative form arises from the specific intention called bodily action, then what follows? It would follow that nonindicative form would be concomitant with the mind, like the nonindicative states of one equipoise.

original: ro // de ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ro // de ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: That is not so,

original: sems pa'i khyad par gyis de'i 'phen pa khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa'i khyad par gyis de'i 'phen pa khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the specific intention projects it in a special way.

original: rnam par rig byed de yod na yang de 'phang bar bya ba ni sems @169a * //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed de yod na yang de 'phang bar bya ba ni sems @169a * //
translated: If there is informative action, the action of the body is dependent on the power of the mind,

original: pa'i stobs la rag las pa yin te de blun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i stobs la rag las pa yin te de blun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body is like a piece of wood.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re dbyibs kyang rdzas kho na yin la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re dbyibs kyang rdzas kho na yin la /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that shape is a real entity.

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩngag rnams rig byed 'di ngag sgra //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid yin no zhes zer ro // ngag rnams rig byed 'di ngag sgra //

analyzed: ngag gi rang bzhin gyi sgra gang yin pa de nyid ngag gi rnam par rig byed yin no //

analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni sngar bshad pa kho na yin no //

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re yang rdzas su med de /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re yang rdzas su med de /
translated: The SautrƒÅntikas say that it does not exist as a real entity.

original: khas blangs nas mi byed pa tsam gyi phyir dang / 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la yang brten nas 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir dang zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khas blangs nas mi byed pa tsam gyi phyir dang / 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la yang brten nas 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir dang zhes zer ro //
translated: They are not form because they are merely the nonperformance of what has been promised, because they are imputed in dependence on past primary elements, because they lack intrinsic reality, and because they lack the characteristics of form.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: They exist.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know?üîΩBecause it is said that form is threefold, stainless form,

original: rnam gsum dri med gzugs gsungs dang // 'phel dang ma byas lam sogs phyir //
analyzed: rnam gsum dri med gzugs gsungs dang // 'phel dang ma byas lam sogs phyir //
translated: because it increases, because it is not created, because it is a path, and so on.üîΩA sutra states:

analyzed: mdo las / gnas gsum gyi gzugs kyis gzugs bsdus pa yin te / bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyang yod /

analyzed: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyang yod /
translated: there is form that is not demonstrable but impeded,üîΩand there is form that is neither demonstrable nor impeded.

analyzed: bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa'i gzugs kyang yod do zhes gzugs rnam pa gsum gsungs so ;
translated: It is said that form is threefold.

original: / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the uncontaminated phenomena?

original: gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba gang dang rnam par shes pa'i bar gang la rjes su chags pa'am khong khro ba mi skye ba 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o zhes gzugs zag pa med pa yang gsungs te

analyzed: / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs par ni bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa'i gzugs kyang med la zag pa med pa yang med do //

original: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bdun po 'di dag dang ldan pa'i dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo ni rgyu yang rung 'dug kyang rung nyal yang rung mi nyal yang rung ste /

analyzed: rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes 'phel bar yang gsungs te /

analyzed: gzhan dag byed du bcug pa'i las kyi lam dag 'grub par mi 'gyur te /

original: lung du bsgo ba tsam gyis las kyi lam du mi rung ste /
analyzed: lung du bsgo ba tsam gyis las kyi lam du mi rung ste /

original: las de ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las de ma byas pa'i phyir ro //

original: byas su zin kyang de'i rang gi ngo bo la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas su zin kyang de'i rang gi ngo bo la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong chos ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said, ‚ÄúMonks, Dharma is an external base.

analyzed: skye mched bcu gcig gis ma bsdus pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa'o zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: It is not subsumed by the eleven bases, it is undemonstrable, and it is unimpeded.‚Äù

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'o zhes ni ma gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'o zhes ni ma gsungs te /
translated: But it is not said that it is not form.

original: der gal te chos kyi skye mched kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs shig ma gzigs na dgos pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der gal te chos kyi skye mched kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs shig ma gzigs na dgos pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept imperceptible form as a part of the sense sphere of mental objects, what purpose is served by its existence?

analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs med na lam yan lag brgyad par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no imperceptible form, the path would not have eight members,

analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams mi rung ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'o na 'di skad du de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba de'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //

translated: But it is said, ‚ÄúOne who knows and sees in this way completely develops right view, right thought, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.‚Äù

analyzed: 'di'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams ni sngon yongs su dag cing yongs su byang ba yin no zhes gang gsungs so zhe na /
translated: His speech, action, and livelihood are already pure and cleansed.

original: 'di ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar byas pa la dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar byas pa la dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is said with reference to one who has already become free from attachment by the mundane path.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med na so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med na so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no noninformative form, then the prƒÅtimok·π£a vows would not exist.

analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu gang gis na yid gzhan dang ldan pa 'di yang dge slong ngam dge slong mar 'gyur ba de ni med do //

analyzed: mdo las spong ba ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi bgegs byed pa'i phyir chu lon du yang gsungs te /

analyzed: 'di ni sna tshogs pa yang yin mod kyi 'di de ltar yang ma yin no zhes zer mod /
translated: The Sautrantikas say: This is a multitude and it is various, but it is not like that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: @170a * // re zhig gang gzugs rnam pa gsum gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa /

translated: YogacƒÅrƒÅ·∏• say: That form which is produced by the power of concentration is uncontaminated in the uncontaminated concentration.

analyzed: gzhan dag na re dgra bcom pa'i gzugs dang / phyi rol gang yin pa ste /
translated: Others say: The form of an arhat and external form are uncontaminated,

analyzed: mig ji snyed pa dang / gzugs ji snyed pa dag yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs so zhe na /

analyzed: de ni zag pa rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas par gsungs pa yin no //

original: mtshan nyid 'tshol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'tshol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The investigation of characteristics would be pointless.

original: ji ltar de zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa de ltar nam yang zag pa med pa ma yin pas 'di la 'chol ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: ji ltar de zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa de ltar nam yang zag pa med pa ma yin pas 'di la 'chol ba ci zhig yod /

original: gal te yang gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa dag yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa dag yin par 'gyur na /

analyzed: ci'i phyir mdo las gzugs zag pa dang bcas pa'i nye bar len par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni sems kyi thab dang spags pa'i gzhi yin no zhes rgya cher khyad par du mdzad par 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúThose contaminated appropriated aggregates that are the basis of the mind‚Äôs bondage and the basis of its entanglements are the basis of the mind‚Äôs bondage and the basis of its entanglements‚Äù?üîΩAlso, the statement that the sutra declares that merit increases is not correct, because former masters say:

original: gang yang bsod nams mngon par 'phel bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de la yang sngon gyi slob dpon dag na re ji lta ji ltar sbyin pa po rnams kyi sbyin par bya ba dag yongs su spyad pa de lta de ltar za ba po rnams
analyzed: gang yang bsod nams mngon par 'phel bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de la yang sngon gyi slob dpon dag na re ji lta ji ltar sbyin pa po rnams kyi sbyin par bya ba dag yongs su spyad pa de lta de ltar za ba po rnams
translated: ‚ÄúAs givers enjoy giving, as recipients enjoy receiving, and as those who enjoy giving enjoy giving, merit increases.

original: kyi yon tan gyi khyad par dang / phan btags pa'i khyad par gyis yid gzhan dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa po rnams la yang gang gis na tshe phyi ma la 'bras bu ches mang po @170b mngon par bsgrub nus par 'gyur ba de la dmigs pa'i sbyin pa'i sems pas yongs su bsgos pa'i rgyu de
analyzed: kyi yon tan gyi khyad par dang / phan btags pa'i khyad par gyis yid gzhan dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa po rnams la yang gang gis na tshe phyi ma la 'bras bu ches mang po @170b mngon par bsgrub nus par 'gyur ba de la dmigs pa'i sbyin pa'i sems pas yongs su bsgos pa'i rgyu de
translated: and the special qualities of the field and the special benefit conferred, then the mind of generosity that focuses on that field will be imbued with a cause that is fully transformed,

analyzed: yongs su 'gyur pa'i khyad par phra mo 'thob pa 'di ni chos nyid yin te /

original: bsod nams mngon par 'phel ba kho nar 'gyur zhing bsod nams nye bar skye ba kho nar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'di las dgongs te gsungs pa srid do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams mngon par 'phel ba kho nar 'gyur zhing bsod nams nye bar skye ba kho nar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'di las dgongs te gsungs pa srid do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúmerit increases and merit alone is born‚Äù is an example of a statement that is made with a specific intention.

original: 'on te de ji ltar na rgyud gzhan gyi khyad par gyis yid gzhan dang ldan pa'i rgyud gzhan yongs su 'gyur bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on te de ji ltar na rgyud gzhan gyi khyad par gyis yid gzhan dang ldan pa'i rgyud gzhan yongs su 'gyur bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúHow can a mind that is different due to the difference in another mind series be fully transformed?‚Äù

original: na rgyud gzhan gyi khyad par gyis yid gzhan dang ldan pa'i la chos gzhan rnam par rig byed ma yin par 'gyur zhes rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: na rgyud gzhan gyi khyad par gyis yid gzhan dang ldan pa'i la chos gzhan rnam par rig byed ma yin par 'gyur zhes rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The same is true of noninformative form, which is a special quality of a mindstream that possesses a different mind.

original: da ni rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dag la ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: da ni rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dag la ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, how is it that there is merit from things that are not derived from substances?

original: yang dang yang du de la dmigs pa'i sems pa la goms pas rmi lam dag na yang de dag rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang du de la dmigs pa'i sems pa la goms pas rmi lam dag na yang de dag rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through repeated habituation to the mind that observes them, they are connected to the mind even in dreams.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin par smra ba'i ltar na rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa gang la rnam par rig byed med pa de la ji ltar rnam par rig byed ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin par smra ba'i ltar na rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa gang la rnam par rig byed med pa de la ji ltar rnam par rig byed ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: According to those who advocate noninformative form, how can that which is not derived from substances and does not have informative form be noninformative form?

original: gzhan dag na re rdzas las byung ba dag la yang dang yang du de la dmigs pa'i sems pa de la goms par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rdzas las byung ba dag la yang dang yang du de la dmigs pa'i sems pa de la goms par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Even in those derived from substances, the mind that observes them is habituated to them.

original: 'o na mdo las gang drag shul can dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las gang drag shul can dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
translated: Well then, what is the meaning of the sutra that states:

analyzed: dge ba'i chos dang ldan pas gang gi bsod snyoms yongs su zos nas sems kyi ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa lus kyis mngon du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas na /
translated: ‚ÄúO Virtuous Monks, if one who possesses ethical discipline and who possesses virtue were to consume the alms of another, and if he were to actualize and perfect immeasurable mental concentration through his body,üîΩthen, on the basis of that, one should expect immeasurable merit and virtue and a basis of happiness to arise for the donor through the gifts of that donor.‚Äù

original: de'i gzhi las sbyin pa po'i sbyin pa dag gis bsod nams kyi rgyu mthun pa dang / dge ba'i rgyu mthun pa dang / bde ba'i gzhi tshad med par re bar bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la de'i tshe sbyin pa po'i sems pa'i khyad par gang zhig yin no //
analyzed: de'i gzhi las sbyin pa po'i sbyin pa dag gis bsod nams kyi rgyu mthun pa dang / dge ba'i rgyu mthun pa dang / bde ba'i gzhi tshad med par re bar bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la de'i tshe sbyin pa po'i sems pa'i khyad par gang zhig yin no //
translated: At that time, what is the special intention of the donor?

original: de lta bas na rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par kho na rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par kho na rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is only the special transformation of the continuum that is reasonable.

original: gang yang byed du bcug pa'i las kyi lam du ji ltar 'gyur zhes smras pa de la yang 'di skad du de'i sbyor bas gzhan dag la gnod pa'i bye brag gis sbyor ba po la rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par phra mo gang las na tshe phyi
analyzed: gang yang byed du bcug pa'i las kyi lam du ji ltar 'gyur zhes smras pa de la yang 'di skad du de'i sbyor bas gzhan dag la gnod pa'i bye brag gis sbyor ba po la rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par phra mo gang las na tshe phyi
translated: In response to this, we say that the continuum of the instigator is transformed by the specific harm done to another through his instigation.

original: ma la 'bras bu ches mang po mngon par 'grub nus pa'i rgyu de skye bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod de /üîΩbdag @171a * //üîΩnyid kyi byed pa la 'ang bya ba'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs nas tshul ni 'di nyid yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩrgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par 'di ni las kyi lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma la 'bras bu ches mang po mngon par 'grub nus pa'i rgyu de skye bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod de / bdag @171a * // nyid kyi byed pa la 'ang bya ba'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs nas tshul ni 'di nyid yin par rig par bya'o // rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par 'di ni las kyi lam zhes bya ste /
translated: From this transformation, a cause is produced that is able to generate a much greater result in the future.üîΩThis is the way it is understood that the result of action is not lost.

original: 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This transformation of the continuum is called the path of action because the result is designated as the cause.

analyzed: lus kyi dang ngag gi ni de dag gi bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na rnam par rig byed ma yin par smra ba rnams kyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa lta bu'o // btsun pa na re 'di gang gi tshe zin pa'i phung po dag la bsad par bya'o //
translated: and verbal and physical karma are the results of the action of those two, like nonindicative form for those who advocate nonindicative form.

original: gsod do // bsad do snyam du sems pa na dus gsum pa'i sems pas srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: gsod do // bsad do snyam du sems pa na dus gsum pa'i sems pas srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: The Bhadanta says: When one kills those who possess appropriated aggregates, one is contacted by the fault of taking life through intention in the three times, thinking, I will kill, I am killing, I killed.

original: ma la sogs pa ma bsad par bsad do snyam pa'i nga rgyal can rnams la /
analyzed: ma la sogs pa ma bsad par bsad do snyam pa'i nga rgyal can rnams la /
translated: If one kills one's mother and so on, but thinks I have not killed her,üîΩone would come to possess the heinous karma of killing one's mother and so on.üîΩTherefore the karmic path is not complete merely by that.

original: mtshams med pa'i las kyi lam du 'gyur du 'ongs pas de tsam gyis las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin gyi 'di la bsam pa ni bdag nyid kyis gsod pa la sems pa de snyed cig kun du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di yin par
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i las kyi lam du 'gyur du 'ongs pas de tsam gyis las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin gyi 'di la bsam pa ni bdag nyid kyis gsod pa la sems pa de snyed cig kun du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di yin par

original: rigs pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: This is the nature of reasoning.

original: da ni rnam par rig byed ma yin ba ni spong bar byed cing de kho na dang 'dra bar mi mngon par rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag khas len par byed pa'i rab tu snang ba de gang zhe na /
analyzed: da ni rnam par rig byed ma yin ba ni spong bar byed cing de kho na dang 'dra bar mi mngon par rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag khas len par byed pa'i rab tu snang ba de gang zhe na /
translated: Now, what is this illumination that rejects imperceptible form and accepts a transformation of the continuum that is similar to it but not manifest?

original: rab tu snang ba ni ci yang med mod kyi 'on kyang sems kyi rgyu las byung ba'i lus kyi sbyor bas bya ba yongs su rdzogs na sbyor ba po la de dag dang tha dad par gyur pa'i chos gzhan zhig na skye'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su
analyzed: rab tu snang ba ni ci yang med mod kyi 'on kyang sems kyi rgyu las byung ba'i lus kyi sbyor bas bya ba yongs su rdzogs na sbyor ba po la de dag dang tha dad par gyur pa'i chos gzhan zhig na skye'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su
translated: There is no illumination at all, but when the activity of the body‚Äôs performance is completed through the performance of the body that arises from the mind, then something different from the performer arises as a different dharma.

original: dga' ba mi skye'o //
analyzed: dga' ba mi skye'o //

original: gang gis byas pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa de kho na la de'i rgyu can gyi rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni yongs su dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis byas pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa de kho na la de'i rgyu can gyi rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni yongs su dga' bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud las tshe phyi ma la 'bras bu byung ba'i yang phyir ro //

original: 'di la bshad kyang zin to //
analyzed: 'di la bshad kyang zin to //

original: ji skad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad ce na /

original: rnam par rig byed med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //

original: gang yang 'di ltar chos kyi skye mched gzugs can ma yin par gsungs so zhes smras pa ni bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de nyid chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang 'di ltar chos kyi skye mched gzugs can ma yin par gsungs so zhes smras pa ni bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de nyid chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: You have also said that the element of the dharmas is declared to be non-material. But that very form which is undemonstrable and non-resistant is included in the element of the dharmas.üîΩYou have also said that the eight members of the noble path would not exist. original: gang yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni re zhig ji ltar na lam la snyoms par @171b zhugs pa la yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dag yod pa khyod smros shig / ci 'di tshig tu smra 'am /
analyzed: gang yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni re zhig ji ltar na lam la snyoms par @171b zhugs pa la yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dag yod pa khyod smros shig / ci 'di tshig tu smra 'am /

original: smras pa / ma yin no //

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: gang zhig thob pa'i phyir langs na yang log pa'i ngag la sogs pa dag la ni mi 'jug la /

translated: Therefore the reason is imputed to be the one with the reason and nonindicative form is explained to be that.üîΩIf that is so, then in this system also, one who enters the path of meditative equipoise obtains the mind and body that are the basis for obtaining that, even though nonindicative form does not exist.

analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa dag la ni 'jug par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i bsam pa dang lus thob par 'gyur te /

translated: Others say: Here the mere nonperformance of those is said to be a branch,

analyzed: 'dis 'phags pa'i lam gyi mthus nges par mi byed par 'thob pa gang yin pa de yang zag pa med pa'i lam la brten nas 'thob pa'i phyir zag pa med pa yin no //

analyzed: thams cad du rdzas su yod pa'i chos yongs su bgrang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that all uncontaminated phenomena are counted as branches,

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom par yang 'gyur te /
translated: It is also the prƒÅtimok·π£a restraint,

original: sems pa gang gis cho ga sngon du btang ba'i khas blangs te las bkag nas lus dang ngag dag sdom par byed do //
analyzed: sems pa gang gis cho ga sngon du btang ba'i khas blangs te las bkag nas lus dang ngag dag sdom par byed do //

analyzed: gal te sems gzhan dang ldan na ma bsdams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one has another thought, the restraint would not exist.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /

analyzed: de la goms par byas pa'i dus su dran pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: chu lon gyi ngo bor yang 'gyur te / ngo tsha shes pas mi bya bar dam @172a * //

analyzed: de lta bu kho na'i don du de yang dag par len pa yang yin no //

analyzed: rgyas par ni mi dgos so //
translated: It is unnecessary to elaborate further.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs rdzas gzhan kho nar yod do zhes zer ro //üîΩgal te yod la de yang 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa yin no zhes bshad na de ci rnam par rig byed kyi 'byung ba dag kho na rgyur byas nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skye ba'am /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs rdzas gzhan kho nar yod do zhes zer ro // gal te yod la de yang 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa yin no zhes bshad na de ci rnam par rig byed kyi 'byung ba dag kho na rgyur byas nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skye ba'am /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Nonindicative form is a substance that exists separately.

original: 'on te gzhan dag kyang yin zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dag kyang yin zhe na / smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: If it exists and if it is said to be derived from the primary elements, then does nonindicative form arise from the primary elements of indicative form or from other primary elements?üîΩIt arises from other primary elements.

original: de ni 'byung ba chen po gzhan dang gzhan dag kho na rgyur byas nas skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'byung ba chen po gzhan dang gzhan dag kho na rgyur byas nas skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: It arises from other primary elements alone.

original: tshogs pa de nyid 'bras bu phra mo can yang yin la ;
analyzed: tshogs pa de nyid 'bras bu phra mo can yang yin la ;
translated: That collection is also the cause of subtle results.

original: 'bras bu rags pa can yang yin par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu rags pa can yang yin par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible that the effect is gross.üîΩBut when noninformative form exists, does it arise in dependence on the great elements that exist at that time?

original: yang ci de gang gi tshe rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yod pa de'i tshe yod pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag kho na rgyur byas nas 'byung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci de gang gi tshe rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yod pa de'i tshe yod pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag kho na rgyur byas nas 'byung ngam zhe na /
translated: Or does it arise in dependence on the great elements that existed previously?

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs phal cher thams cad ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs phal cher thams cad ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: In general, derivative form arises in dependence on the great elements that exist at the same time as itself.

original: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa cung zad cig ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa cung zad cig ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas nas 'byung ngo //
translated: But some derivative form of the present and future arises in dependence on the great elements of the past.

original: de yang gang zhe na /üîΩ'dod gtogs rnam rig min skad cig / phyi chad 'das pa'i 'byung las skye //
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na / 'dod gtogs rnam rig min skad cig / phyi chad 'das pa'i 'byung las skye //
translated: What is that?üîΩNoninformative form of the desire realm arises from past elements.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni skad cig ma dang po phyin cad 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas nas skye'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni skad cig ma dang po phyin cad 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas nas skye'o //
translated: Noninformative form of the desire realm arises in dependence on the great elements of the past, beginning from the second moment onward.

original: de dag ni 'di'i gzhi'i don du 'gyur la lus kyi 'byung ba chen po de ltar 'byung ba rnams ni rten gyi don du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di'i gzhi'i don du 'gyur la lus kyi 'byung ba chen po de ltar 'byung ba rnams ni rten gyi don du 'gyur te /
translated: These are the basis of these actions. The great elements of the body are the support of these actions.

original: 'jug pa dang rjes su 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang rjes su 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin te /
translated: They are the cause of the engagement and the subsequent engagement of these actions, respectively.

original: 'khor lo sa la 'dril ba la lag pas 'phul ba dang sa'i phyogs bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khor lo sa la 'dril ba la lag pas 'phul ba dang sa'i phyogs bzhin no //

original: yang gang na yod pa'i lus dang ngag gi las gang na yod pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang gang na yod pa'i lus dang ngag gi las gang na yod pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: In what realm are the great elements that are the cause of the bodily and vocal actions that exist in a certain realm?

original: zag bcas lus dang ngag gi las //üîΩrang gi 'byung ba dag rgyur byas //
analyzed: zag bcas lus dang ngag gi las // rang gi 'byung ba dag rgyur byas //
translated: Sutra says, ‚ÄúThe contaminated bodily and vocal actions of the desire realm are derived from the great elements of the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus dang ngag gi las ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba dag kho na rgyur byas pa yin la /üîΩde bzhin @172b du bsam gtan bzhi ba'i sa pa'i bar du yang de'i sa pa'i 'byung ba dag kho na rgyur byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus dang ngag gi las ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba dag kho na rgyur byas pa yin la / de bzhin @172b du bsam gtan bzhi ba'i sa pa'i bar du yang de'i sa pa'i 'byung ba dag kho na rgyur byas pa yin no //
translated: The bodily and vocal actions of the first absorption are derived from the great elements of the first absorption.üîΩThe same is true up to the fourth absorption.

original: zag med gang du skyes pa yin //
analyzed: zag med gang du skyes pa yin //
translated: The uncontaminated actions of the body and speech of one born in a certain realm are derived from the great elements of that realm.

original: zag pa med pa'i lus dang ngag gi las de ni sa gang du skyes te skyed par byed pa de'i sa pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lus dang ngag gi las de ni sa gang du skyes te skyed par byed pa de'i sa pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa yin te /
translated: That uncontaminated action of body and speech is derived from the great elements of the level on which it is generated.

original: khams gsum ma gtogs pa'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa rnams las 'byung ba dag med pa'i phyir dang / de'i stobs las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum ma gtogs pa'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa rnams las 'byung ba dag med pa'i phyir dang / de'i stobs las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not belong to the three realms, because uncontaminated states have no primary elements, and because it arises from the power of those elements.

original: rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i las de las kyang /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i las de las kyang /
translated: Also, that action of informative form and noninformative form

original: rnam rig byed min ma zin dang // rgyu mthun las byung sems can ston //
analyzed: rnam rig byed min ma zin dang // rgyu mthun las byung sems can ston //
translated: Nonindicative form not conjoined, arisen from actual elements,

original: gzhan yang / rgyu mthun zin pa'i 'byung las skye //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rgyu mthun zin pa'i 'byung las skye //
translated: and also derived from the cause of natural outflow.üîΩNonindicative form arises from the cause of natural outflow and from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rgyu mthun pa dang zin pa'i 'byung ba dag kho na rgyur byas nas skye ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rgyu mthun pa dang zin pa'i 'byung ba dag kho na rgyur byas nas skye ste /
translated: Nonindicative form is derived from the cause of natural outflow and from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: 'di ni mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sa pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sa pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: This is the aspect of the level of nonequipoise.

original: ting 'dzin skyes 'byung ma zin dang // rgyas byung tha dad min las skye //
analyzed: ting 'dzin skyes 'byung ma zin dang // rgyas byung tha dad min las skye //
translated: that are not different from it, and that are derived from enhancement.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yin te de ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa rgyas pa las byung ba dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas nas skye'o
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yin te de ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa rgyas pa las byung ba dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas nas skye'o
translated: That arisen from concentration is the unmanifest form of absorption and uncontaminated vows. It arises from the great elements that are its cause, that are not different from it, and that are derived from enhancement and not from appropriated elements.

original: // tha mi dad pa dag kyang 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: // tha mi dad pa dag kyang 'byung ba yin te /
translated: It arises from the great elements that are not different from it.

original: 'byung ba chen po gang dag kho na rgyur byas nas srog gcod pa spong ba skye ba de dag kho na las tshig kyal pa spong ba'i bar du skye'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po gang dag kho na rgyur byas nas srog gcod pa spong ba skye ba de dag kho na las tshig kyal pa spong ba'i bar du skye'o //
translated: The great elements that are its cause are the same ones from which the abandonment of taking life arises, up to the same ones from which the abandonment of idle speech arises.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems bzhin du 'byung ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems bzhin du 'byung ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the elements are not different from the mind.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni 'byung ba gzhan dang gzhan dag rgyur byas nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bdun skye'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni 'byung ba gzhan dang gzhan dag rgyur byas nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bdun skye'o //
translated: The pratimok·π£a vows arise from the great elements that are its cause, which are different from each other, and from the seven types of unmanifest form.

original: rnam par rig byed ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Indicative form is derived from the cause of natural outflow.

original: lus kyis ni zin pa yin no /
analyzed: lus kyis ni zin pa yin no /
translated: It is conjoined with the body.

original: yang ci rnam par rig byed 'di skye ba na dbyibs snga ma'i rgyud bshig nas skye'am /üîΩ'on te ma yin /
analyzed: yang ci rnam par rig byed 'di skye ba na dbyibs snga ma'i rgyud bshig nas skye'am / 'on te ma yin /
translated: Does this indicative form arise by destroying the continuum of the prior shape or not?

original: de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur /
translated: What is wrong with these?

original: gal te bshig nas skye na ni //
analyzed: gal te bshig nas skye na ni //
translated: If it arises by destroying it,

original: rnam par smin pa'i gzugs chad pa yang rgyun chags pa'i phyir 'di bye brag tu smra ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i gzugs chad pa yang rgyun chags pa'i phyir 'di bye brag tu smra ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika would be refuted because the continuum of the form of karmic maturation would be severed.

original: 'on te ma bshig par skye na ni ji ltar 'byung ba'i tshogs gcig la dbyibs gnyis 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te ma bshig par skye na ni ji ltar 'byung ba'i tshogs gcig la dbyibs gnyis 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: But if it arises without destroying it, then how could two shapes be established in a single collection of primary elements?

original: de'i tshe gang dag rgyur byas nas rnam par rig byed skye bar 'gyur ba rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i 'byung ba chen po gzhan dang / gzhan de @173a * //üîΩdag skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang dag rgyur byas nas rnam par rig byed skye bar 'gyur ba rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i 'byung ba chen po gzhan dang / gzhan de @173a * //üîΩdag skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, other primary elements derived from natural outflow that serve as the cause for the arising of indicative form arise.

original: de dag de lta na ni 'o na de'i 'byung ba chen po de dag gis mngon par khyab pa'i phyir yan lag dang gang dang gang la brten nas rnam par rig byed skye bar 'gyur ba'i yan lag de dang de chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag de lta na ni 'o na de'i 'byung ba chen po de dag gis mngon par khyab pa'i phyir yan lag dang gang dang gang la brten nas rnam par rig byed skye bar 'gyur ba'i yan lag de dang de chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then since those great elements pervade the body, the parts of the body on which the informative form is based would be enlarged, because they are pervaded by those great elements.

original: mngon par ma khyab na ni ji ltar na yan lag zad par gyis rnam par rig par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon par ma khyab na ni ji ltar na yan lag zad par gyis rnam par rig par byed par 'gyur /
translated: If they do not pervade, how could the informative form be produced by the entire body?

original: lus la gseb yod pa'i phyir de dag gi go skabs yod do //
analyzed: lus la gseb yod pa'i phyir de dag gi go skabs yod do //
translated: There is room for them because there are spaces in the body.

original: yang las de rnam grangs kyis rnam pa gnyis dang rnam pa gsum dang / rnam pa lngar bshad pa de la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: yang las de rnam grangs kyis rnam pa gnyis dang rnam pa gsum dang / rnam pa lngar bshad pa de la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The two types of action, the three types of action, and the five types of action that were explained above are as follows: Nonindicative form is of two types: virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: rnam rig min lung bstan min med //
analyzed: rnam rig min lung bstan min med //
translated: Nonindicative form is not neutral.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ni stobs chung ba yin te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ni stobs chung ba yin te /
translated: Because neutral minds are weak.

original: de'i phyir gang 'gags kyang de'i rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ba'i las stobs dang ldan pa 'phen par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'gags kyang de'i rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ba'i las stobs dang ldan pa 'phen par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, when the action is interrupted, it is not capable of projecting a powerful action that would be linked to it.

original: gzhan ni rnam gsum /
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam gsum /
translated: The other is of three types.

original: las gzhan ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: las gzhan ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: The other action is of three types: wholesome, unwholesome, indeterminate.

original: gzhan de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is this other action?

original: rnam par rig byed dang / sems pa'o //üîΩmi dge ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang / sems pa'o // mi dge ni /
translated: It is informative action and non-informative action.üîΩUnwholesome action exists in the realm of desire.

original: 'dod na'o // mi dge ba'i las ni 'dod pa'i khams na yod par rig par bya'o //üîΩgzhan dag na ni med de /
analyzed: 'dod na'o // mi dge ba'i las ni 'dod pa'i khams na yod par rig par bya'o // gzhan dag na ni med de /
translated: Unwholesome action exists in the realm of desire.

original: mi dag pa'i rtsa ba rnams dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dag spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dag pa'i rtsa ba rnams dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dag spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not exist in the other realms, because the roots of unwholesomeness, shamelessness and lack of conscience are absent there.

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma bkag pa'i phyir thams cad na yod do //
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma bkag pa'i phyir thams cad na yod do //
translated: Wholesome and indeterminate action exist everywhere, because they are not prohibited.

original: de la gzugs na'ang rnam rig min //
analyzed: de la gzugs na'ang rnam rig min //
translated: In the realm of form, there is also non-informative action.

original: yang gi sgras ni 'dod pa na yang yod do //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni 'dod pa na yang yod do //
translated: The word also indicates that informative action exists in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs med pa dag na ni 'byung ba med pa'i phyir med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag na ni 'byung ba med pa'i phyir med do //
translated: It does not exist in the formless realm, because the primary elements are absent there.

original: gang na lus dang ngag dang 'jug pa de na lus dang ngag gi sdom pa yod do //
analyzed: gang na lus dang ngag dang 'jug pa de na lus dang ngag gi sdom pa yod do //
translated: Where there is body and speech, there is the restraint of body and speech.

original: 'o na 'dir snyoms par 'jug pa la yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir snyoms par 'jug pa la yod par 'gyur te /
translated: But it exists in meditative attainment,

original: zag pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like uncontaminated non-informative form.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It does not exist there,

original: de ni khams su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni khams su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not included in the elements.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni skal pa mi mnyam pa'i 'byung ba rgyur byas nas skye ba ni 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni skal pa mi mnyam pa'i 'byung ba rgyur byas nas skye ba ni 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not suitable for uncontaminated non-informative form of the formless realm to arise from homogeneous primary elements,

original: gzugs thams cad la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir yang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gzugs skyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: gzugs thams cad la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir yang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gzugs skyed par mi nus te /
translated: because it is not possible for the formless realm to generate form, since it is averse to all form.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is free from the discernment of form.

original: bye brag @173b tu smra ba rnams na re tshul khrims ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po yin la /
analyzed: bye brag @173b tu smra ba rnams na re tshul khrims ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po yin la /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Ethics is the antidote to immorality.

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa yin na gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams nas rten dang rnam pa dang dmigs pa dang gnyen po ring ba dag gis ring ste /
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa yin na gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams nas rten dang rnam pa dang dmigs pa dang gnyen po ring ba dag gis ring ste /
translated: Moreover, that immorality exists in the realm of desire, but the formless realm is far removed from the realm of desire in terms of basis, aspect, object, and antidote.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med do zhes zer ro //üîΩrnam rig dpyod dang bcas dag na //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med do zhes zer ro // rnam rig dpyod dang bcas dag na //
translated: Therefore, they say that the formless realm does not have nonindicative form.üîΩVedic recitation and investigation exist in the first absorption alone.

original: rnam par rig byed ni sa gnyis po 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po kho na na yod kyi de yan chad na ni med do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni sa gnyis po 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po kho na na yod kyi de yan chad na ni med do //
translated: Vedic recitation exists in the first absorption alone, not in the second and so on.

original: 'dod pa na yang bsgribs pa med na /
analyzed: 'dod pa na yang bsgribs pa med na /
translated: Vedic recitation does not exist in the desire realm.

original: bsgribs pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ni 'dod pa'i khams na yang med kyi tshangs pa'i 'jig rten kho na na yod do //
analyzed: bsgribs pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ni 'dod pa'i khams na yang med kyi tshangs pa'i 'jig rten kho na na yod do //
translated: Vedic recitation does not exist in the desire realm, but it exists in the world of Brahma alone.

original: tshangs pa chen po la yang g-yos kun nas slong ba'i ngag gi las yod de /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po la yang g-yos kun nas slong ba'i ngag gi las yod de /
translated: Great Brahma also has verbal karma that motivates movement.

original: des rang gi 'khor gyi nang du tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la gtam rlung bskur ba'i phyir bdag nyid rnam par bsngags so zhes grag go //
analyzed: des rang gi 'khor gyi nang du tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la gtam rlung bskur ba'i phyir bdag nyid rnam par bsngags so zhes grag go //
translated: It is said that he praised himself in the presence of his retinue in order to spread a rumor about the elder A≈õvajit.

original: de yan chad ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed med na sgra'i skye mched ji ltar yod ce na /
analyzed: de yan chad ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed med na sgra'i skye mched ji ltar yod ce na /
translated: How can the sense sphere of sound exist if there is no vocal informative form?

original: phyi'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyur byas pa yod do //üîΩgzhan dag na re bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na yang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par rig byed ni yod kyi dge ba yang med la /
analyzed: phyi'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyur byas pa yod do // gzhan dag na re bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na yang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par rig byed ni yod kyi dge ba yang med la /
translated: It exists as derived from the great elements that are external to the body.

original: nyon mongs pa can yang med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yang med do //
translated: Others say: In the second absorption and above, there is nonvirtuous and neutral informative form, but there is no virtuous or afflicted informative form.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag tu skyes ba ni sa 'og ma pa'i sems gang gis na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni mngon sum du mi byed de /
analyzed: de dag tu skyes ba ni sa 'og ma pa'i sems gang gis na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni mngon sum du mi byed de /
translated: Beings born in those levels do not manifest the minds of lower levels that motivate informative form because they are inferior and have already been abandoned.

original: dman pa dang spangs zin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te snga ma kho na brjod do //
analyzed: dman pa dang spangs zin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te snga ma kho na brjod do //
translated: This is the same as the former explanation.

original: ci'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yan chad na rnam par rig byed med la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yan chad na rnam par rig byed med la /
translated: Why is there no informative form above the heaven of Brahma?

original: 'dod pa'i khams na yang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa med ce na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na yang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa med ce na /
translated: Why is there no obscured neutral form in the desire realm?

original: gang phyir kun slong med /
analyzed: gang phyir kun slong med /
translated: Because there is no motivation.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed na /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed na /
translated: When the mind possessing investigation and analysis motivates informative form,

original: de yang bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na med do //
analyzed: de yang bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na med do //
translated: that mind does not exist in the second absorption and so on.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya bas slong bar byed kyi de kha nang du bltas pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya bas slong bar byed kyi de kha nang du bltas pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is motivated by that which is abandoned by the path of meditation, but it is not abandoned by the path of seeing because that is directed internally.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems de yang 'dod pa'i khams na med do /
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems de yang 'dod pa'i khams na med do /
translated: Also, that obscured neutral mind does not exist in the desire realm.

original: yang ni kun nas slong ba'i dbang po kho na las chos rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du rig par bya 'am zhe na /üîΩ@174a * // smas pa /
analyzed: yang ni kun nas slong ba'i dbang po kho na las chos rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du rig par bya 'am zhe na / @174a * // smas pa /
translated: Is the virtue and nonvirtue of phenomena known only from the motivating faculty?

original: ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin no // 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: No, they are known

original: rnam pa bzhis te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis te /
translated: in four ways.

original: don dam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas slong bas so //
analyzed: don dam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas slong bas so //
translated: 1. in the ultimate sense; 2. by nature; 3. through association; 4. through origination.

original: de la re zhig / thar pa dam pa'i don du dge / mya ngan las 'das pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin te de bas na mchog tu bde ba'i phyir don dam par dge ba ste nad med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig / thar pa dam pa'i don du dge / mya ngan las 'das pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin te de bas na mchog tu bde ba'i phyir don dam par dge ba ste nad med pa bzhin no //
translated: 1. In the ultimate sense, liberation is good, because it is the supreme happiness. Nirvana is the appeasement of all unsatisfactoriness. Therefore, it is good in the ultimate sense, like health.

original: rtsa ba ngo tsha khrel yod bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: rtsa ba ngo tsha khrel yod bdag nyid kyis //
translated: 2. By nature, the three roots of good are good, because they are, by nature, shame and modesty.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dang po tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa na gzhan mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas slong ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis dge ba yin te 'phrod pa'i sman bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dang po tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa na gzhan mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas slong ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis dge ba yin te 'phrod pa'i sman bzhin no //
translated: The three roots of good, i.e., non-greed, non-hatred, non-delusion, are good by nature, because they are, by nature, shame and modesty, and do not depend on anything else, either association or origination, in order to be good, like medicine that is good by its nature.

original: de dag dang ldan mtshungs ldan gyis //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan mtshungs ldan gyis //
translated: 3. Through association, that which is associated with them is good.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa de dag nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pas dge ba dag yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa de dag nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pas dge ba dag yin te /
translated: The dharmas that are associated with those roots of virtue, with shame and with modesty are virtuous by association.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa rnams la dge ba nyid med pa'i phyir sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa rnams la dge ba nyid med pa'i phyir sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba bzhin no //
translated: They are like a drink mixed with medicine.

original: bya ba la sogs kun slong bas //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs kun slong bas //
translated: Action, etc. are motivated by that.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos de dag kho nas kun nas slong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las dang / skye ba la sogs pa dang / thob pa dang / 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni kun nas slong ba'i dge ba yin te sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba las 'byung ba'i 'o ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos de dag kho nas kun nas slong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las dang / skye ba la sogs pa dang / thob pa dang / 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni kun nas slong ba'i dge ba yin te sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba las 'byung ba'i 'o ma bzhin no //
translated: The actions of body and speech, the birth, etc., the attainments, the cessation, and the meditative attainment of nonperception that are motivated by those dharmas that are associated with the roots of virtue, etc. are virtuous by motivation. They are like the milk that comes from a cow that has drunk a drink mixed with medicine.

original: bskal pa mi mnyam pa'i sems kyi kun nas slong ba'i thob pa rnams ji ltar dge ba nyid yin pa ni brjod dgos so //üîΩdge ba ji skad du bshad pa de las /
analyzed: bskal pa mi mnyam pa'i sems kyi kun nas slong ba'i thob pa rnams ji ltar dge ba nyid yin pa ni brjod dgos so // dge ba ji skad du bshad pa de las /
translated: It must be explained how the obtainment of that which is motivated by a dissimilar mind is virtuous.üîΩIt is the opposite of what was explained as virtuous.

original: bzlog pa ni mi dge / ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni mi dge / ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is it the opposite?

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis mchog tu mi bde ba'i phyir don dam par mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis mchog tu mi bde ba'i phyir don dam par mi dge ba yin no //
translated: It is ultimately unwholesome because it is the nature of all the sufferings of cyclic existence, which are the most unpleasant.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: The roots of nonvirtue, shamelessness, and absence of embarrassment are unwholesome by nature.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pas so //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pas so //
translated: Those phenomena concomitant with them are unwholesome by concomitance.

original: de dag gis kun nas slong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las dang / skye ba la sogs pa dang / thob pa rnams ni kun nas slong ba las te nang dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman la sogs pas dper bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis kun nas slong ba'i lus dang ngag gi las dang / skye ba la sogs pa dang / thob pa rnams ni kun nas slong ba las te nang dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman la sogs pas dper bya'o //
translated: The karma of body and speech motivated by them, birth, and so on, and obtainment are unwholesome by motivation. They are like, for example, unwholesome medicine and so on.

original: de lta na 'o na ni 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa cung zad kyang lung du ma bstan pa'am /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa cung zad kyang lung du ma bstan pa'am /
translated: If that were so, then not even the slightest contaminated phenomenon would be neutral because it would be included within samsara.üîΩ

original: dge bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dge bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then since they belong to the realm of sar·πÉsƒÅra, they would not be neutral or virtuous.

original: @174b don dam par de skad du bshad kyi zag pa dang bcas pa gang zhig rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: @174b don dam par de skad du bshad kyi zag pa dang bcas pa gang zhig rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya la /
translated: They are explained in that way in terms of the ultimate, but that which is contaminated is called neutral because it is karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba can ni dge ba zhes bya'o //üîΩgal te don dam par lung du ma bstan pa btsal na ni de la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba can ni dge ba zhes bya'o // gal te don dam par lung du ma bstan pa btsal na ni de la /
translated: That which has pleasant karmic maturation is called virtuous.

original: don dam par lung ma bstan pa dag /'dus ma byas /
analyzed: don dam par lung ma bstan pa dag /'dus ma byas /
translated: If you seek neutral states in terms of the ultimate, then they are neutral in terms of the ultimate.üîΩUnconditioned states are neutral in terms of the ultimate.

original: gnyis po nam mkha' dang so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ni rnam grangs med par lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gnyis po nam mkha' dang so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ni rnam grangs med par lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: Space and nonanalytical cessation are neutral without exception.

original: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now this should be analyzed:

original: gal te kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis lus dang ngag gi las dag dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis lus dang ngag gi las dag dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid yin na /
translated: If virtue and nonvirtue are due to motivation, then virtue and nonvirtue would not exist in the absorptions.

original: ci ste 'byung ba chen po rnams ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'byung ba chen po rnams ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are not the great elements,

original: byed pa po ni las la sems pa yin gyi 'byung ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po ni las la sems pa yin gyi 'byung ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: then the agent is not the mind that intends the action, but the great elements.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la ni bsam pa med do //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la ni bsam pa med do //
translated: But there is no intention in the nonindicative states of composure.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i phyir de kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin na ji ltar de dge ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i phyir de kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin na ji ltar de dge ba nyid yin no //
translated: And the noncomposure mind does not motivate them because it is not homogeneous with them. How then are they virtuous?

original: yang na lha'i mig dang rna ba dag kyang dge ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas 'di la 'bad par bya'o /
analyzed: yang na lha'i mig dang rna ba dag kyang dge ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas 'di la 'bad par bya'o /
translated: Or else, it follows that the divine eye and ear are virtuous. Therefore, you should strive in this.

original: mthong nas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa /
analyzed: mthong nas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa /
translated: The mind that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing does not motivate indicative form.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis log par lta ba de las ni log par rtog pa dang log pa'i ngag dang log pa'i las kyi mtha' 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis log par lta ba de las ni log par rtog pa dang log pa'i ngag dang log pa'i las kyi mtha' 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs she na /
translated: Why then did the Lord say, ‚ÄúFrom wrong view, wrong thought and wrong speech arise‚Äù?

original: 'di ni 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction here.üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar / kun slong rnam gnyis rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / kun slong rnam gnyis rgyu dang ni //
translated: Two kinds of motivation are cause and

original: de yi dus kyis slong zhes bya //
analyzed: de yi dus kyis slong zhes bya //
translated: are called motivation at the time.

original: kun nas slong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun nas slong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Motivation is twofold:

original: rgyu'i kun nas slong ba dang / de'i dus kyis kun nas slong ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i kun nas slong ba dang / de'i dus kyis kun nas slong ba ste /
translated: causal motivation and motivation at the time.

original: de'i dus kho na na de yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnyis las dang po rab 'jug byed //
analyzed: de'i dus kho na na de yod pa'i phyir ro // gnyis las dang po rab 'jug byed //
translated: The latter is called motivation at the time because it exists at that time.üîΩThe first is the instigator,

original: gnyis pa rjes su 'jug byed yin //üîΩrgyu'i kun nas slong ba ni 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa rjes su 'jug byed yin // rgyu'i kun nas slong ba ni 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: the second is the instigator of what follows.üîΩCausal motivation is the instigator because it propels.

original: de'i dus kyis kun nas slong ba ni bya ba'i dus su /
analyzed: de'i dus kyis kun nas slong ba ni bya ba'i dus su /
translated: Motivation at the time is the instigator of what follows because it exists at the time of the action.

original: mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the instigator because it engages in conformity with the action.

original: da ni bya ba de la de'i nus pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: da ni bya ba de la de'i nus pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the power of the instigator in that action?

original: 'phangs su zin kyang de med na shi ba bzhin du de yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phangs su zin kyang de med na shi ba bzhin du de yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though it is projected, if it does not exist, the action does not exist, like a dead person.

original: 'o na sems med pa'i sdom pa skye ba la ji ltar yod //üîΩ'o na ni sems dang bcas pa la ches gsal ba @175a * //
analyzed: 'o na sems med pa'i sdom pa skye ba la ji ltar yod // 'o na ni sems dang bcas pa la ches gsal ba @175a * //
translated: How can there be a vow in a mindless state?

original: yin pas nus pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: yin pas nus pa ni de yin no //
translated: If that is so, then since it is very clear in a mind that possesses volition, that is the power.

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: In that case,

original: mthong bas spang bya'i rnam shes ni //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bya'i rnam shes ni //
translated: the consciousness to be abandoned by the path of seeing

original: rab tu 'jug byed yin /
analyzed: rab tu 'jug byed yin /
translated: is the instigator.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni de kun nas slong bar byed pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni de kun nas slong bar byed pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The mind to be abandoned by the path of seeing is the instigator of indicative form because it is the basis of investigation and analysis that motivate it.

original: sems kha phyir bltas pa'i bya ba'i dus na de med pa'i phyir rjes su 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kha phyir bltas pa'i bya ba'i dus na de med pa'i phyir rjes su 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the instigator because it does not exist at the time of the action of the outward facing mind.

original: des kun nas slong ba'i gzugs kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kun nas slong ba'i gzugs kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The form that it instigates would also be abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩWhat would follow from that?

original: cir 'gyur / chos mngon pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cir 'gyur / chos mngon pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would contradict the Abhidharma.

original: gzugs ni rig pa dang ma rig pa dag dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni rig pa dang ma rig pa dag dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Form is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing because it is not incompatible with either insight or ignorance.

original: phyogs 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is a point to be proven.

original: 'o na ni sems dang mtshungs pas bslang ba'i phyir 'byung ba rnams kyang mthong bas spang bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni sems dang mtshungs pas bslang ba'i phyir 'byung ba rnams kyang mthong bas spang bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that is so, then the primary elements would be abandoned by the path of seeing because they are instigated by the mind.

original: de ltar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ji ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba dag tu mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba dag tu mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: They are not like virtue and nonvirtue.

original: yang na 'gyur du zad mod /
analyzed: yang na 'gyur du zad mod /
translated: Or, if you say that they are,

original: de skad brjod pa ni mi nus te /
analyzed: de skad brjod pa ni mi nus te /
translated: then you cannot say that.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos ni rig pa dang ma rig pa dag dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang ma yin la spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos ni rig pa dang ma rig pa dag dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang ma yin la spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because non-defiled phenomena are neither abandoned by the path of seeing nor not to be abandoned, because they are not incompatible with either insight or ignorance.

original: de lta bas na mdo las rgyu'i kun nas slong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'i phyir mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta bas na mdo las rgyu'i kun nas slong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'i phyir mi 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction, since the S≈´tra teaches from the point of view of the instigation of the action.

original: yid ni / bsgom pas spang bya gnyi ga yin //
analyzed: yid ni / bsgom pas spang bya gnyi ga yin //
translated: The mental faculty is of both types in the realm of desire.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni gnyi ga yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni gnyi ga yin te /
translated: The mental consciousness of the realm of desire is of both types.

original: rab tu 'jug par byed pa yang yin la rjes su 'jug par byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug par byed pa yang yin la rjes su 'jug par byed pa yang yin no //
translated: It is instigating and it is also following.

original: lnga ni rjes su 'jug byed yin //
analyzed: lnga ni rjes su 'jug byed yin //
translated: The five are only following.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni rjes su 'jug par byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni rjes su 'jug par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: The five collections of consciousness are only following.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni mu bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni mu bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, there are four alternatives.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni rab tu 'jug par byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni rab tu 'jug par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: The mind susceptible to being abandoned by the path of insight is only instigating.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni rjes su 'jug par byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni rjes su 'jug par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: The five collections of consciousness are only following.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni gnyi ga yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni gnyi ga yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness susceptible to being abandoned by the path of cultivation is both.

original: zag pa med pa ni gnyi ga ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni gnyi ga ma yin no //
translated: The uncontaminated is neither.

original: yang ci rab tu 'jug par byed pa ji lta bar rjes su 'jug par byed pa yang de dang 'dra 'am zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci rab tu 'jug par byed pa ji lta bar rjes su 'jug par byed pa yang de dang 'dra 'am zhe na /
translated: Is the instigator of action the same as the motivator of action?

original: 'di ni nges pa med de /üîΩrab tu 'jug byed dge sogs las //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa med de / rab tu 'jug byed dge sogs las //
translated: This is not certain.

original: rjes 'jug byed kyang rnam gsum @175b 'gyur ;
analyzed: rjes 'jug byed kyang rnam gsum @175b 'gyur ;

original: de yang de dge 'dun nam gang zag las te /
analyzed: de yang de dge 'dun nam gang zag las te /

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge slong ma'i sdom pa rnams ni dge 'dun las so //
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge slong ma'i sdom pa rnams ni dge 'dun las so //

original: gzhan dag ni gang zag las so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gang zag las so //

original: bye brag tu smra ba 'dul ba pa rnams na re rnam pa bcus bsnyen par rdzogs so zhes zer ba bsdu ba'i phyir sogs pa'i sgra smos te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba 'dul ba pa rnams na re rnam pa bcus bsnyen par rdzogs so zhes zer ba bsdu ba'i phyir sogs pa'i sgra smos te /

original: rang 'byung gis ni sangs rgyas dang // rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: rang 'byung gis ni sangs rgyas dang // rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The self-originated are the Buddhas and the Pratyekabuddhas.

original: nges par 'jug pas ni rten lnga po rnams so //
analyzed: nges par 'jug pas ni rten lnga po rnams so //
translated: The definite entry is the five supports.

original: dge slong tshur shog ces byas pas ni grags pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge slong tshur shog ces byas pas ni grags pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The come hither is Yasa and the others.

original: ston par khas blangs pas ni 'od srungs chen po'o //
analyzed: ston par khas blangs pas ni 'od srungs chen po'o //

original: dri ba mnyes pas ni legs sbyin no //
analyzed: dri ba mnyes pas ni legs sbyin no //

original: bla ma'i chos khas blangs pas ni skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i chos khas blangs pas ni skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo'o //
translated: The acceptance of the Dharma of the guru is Mahaprajapati.

original: pho nyas ni chos sbyin no //
analyzed: pho nyas ni chos sbyin no //
translated: The messenger is Dharmadinna.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin par gtogs pa lngas ni mtha' 'khob kyi mi rnams so //
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin par gtogs pa lngas ni mtha' 'khob kyi mi rnams so //
translated: The five belonging to the Vinaya are the barbarians.

original: bcu'i tshogs kyis ni dbus kyi mi rnams so //
analyzed: bcu'i tshogs kyis ni dbus kyi mi rnams so //
translated: The group of ten is the central Indians.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba lan gsum bzlas pas ni sde bzang drug cu'i tshogs kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa rnams te /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba lan gsum bzlas pas ni sde bzang drug cu'i tshogs kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa rnams te /
translated: The triple refuge is the group of sixty good persons.

original: de dag gi so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni gdon mi za bar rnam par rig byed la rag lus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni gdon mi za bar rnam par rig byed la rag lus pa ma yin no //
translated: The pratimoksa vows of these are not necessarily dependent on the indicative form.

original: yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pa de yang dag par blangs pa na dus ji srid cig gi bar du yang dag par blang bar bya zhe na /üîΩji srid 'tsho dang nyin zhag tu //
analyzed: yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pa de yang dag par blangs pa na dus ji srid cig gi bar du yang dag par blang bar bya zhe na / ji srid 'tsho dang nyin zhag tu //
translated: If one correctly takes up the pratimoksa vows, for how long does one take them up?

original: sdom pa yang dag blang bar bya //
analyzed: sdom pa yang dag blang bar bya //
translated: One takes up the vows for as long as one lives or for a day and night.

original: ris bdun gyi so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni //
analyzed: ris bdun gyi so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni //
translated: The pratimoksa vows of the seven classes

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yang dag par blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yang dag par blang bar bya'o //
translated: are taken up for as long as one lives.

original: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni nyin zhag tu'o zhes bya ba de ltar nges so //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni nyin zhag tu'o zhes bya ba de ltar nges so //
translated: The vows of the purificatory fast are taken up for a day and night.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dus kyi mtha' ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' ni gnyis te /
translated: The limit of time is twofold:

original: srog gi mtha' dang / nyin zhag gi mtha'o //
analyzed: srog gi mtha' dang / nyin zhag gi mtha'o //
translated: the limit of life and the limit of a day and night.

original: zla ba phyed la sogs pa ni nyin zhag bzlas pas so ;
analyzed: zla ba phyed la sogs pa ni nyin zhag bzlas pas so ;
translated: A fortnight and so on are repetitions of a day and night.

original: / dus zhes bya ba'i chos de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: / dus zhes bya ba'i chos de ci zhig ce na /
