original: de ni 'du byed yongs su ston pa'i tshig bla dags yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'du byed yongs su ston pa'i tshig bla dags yin te /
translated: It is a term indicating a formation.

original: snang ba'i gnas skabs la ni gling dag na nyin par zhes bya la /
analyzed: snang ba'i gnas skabs la ni gling dag na nyin par zhes bya la /
translated: The state of illumination is called day in the continents.

original: mun pa'i gnas skabs la ni mtshan mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mun pa'i gnas skabs la ni mtshan mo zhes bya'o //
translated: The period of darkness is called night.

original: re zhig ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ni yang dag par blangs pa yod kyang @181a * //
analyzed: re zhig ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ni yang dag par blangs pa yod kyang @181a * //
translated: As long as one lives, one can take up the precepts of the fast.

original: lus skal ba mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang / des kyang /
analyzed: lus skal ba mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang / des kyang /
translated: But, since the bodies of humans are not uniform,

original: der sbyor ba ma byas pa'i phyir dang / mi dran pa'i phyir dang sdom pa mi skye bar rigs na /üîΩyang nyin zhag gi 'og zhag lnga 'am zhag bcu yang rung ste /
analyzed: der sbyor ba ma byas pa'i phyir dang / mi dran pa'i phyir dang sdom pa mi skye bar rigs na / yang nyin zhag gi 'og zhag lnga 'am zhag bcu yang rung ste /
translated: it is not possible for the restraint of the fast to arise in those who have not prepared themselves for it, because they do not remember the precepts.

original: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa yang mang po skye ba la su zhig bgegs byed /
analyzed: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa yang mang po skye ba la su zhig bgegs byed /
translated: But, if the restraint of the fast does not arise in those who have not prepared themselves for it, why would it not arise for five or ten days, or more, after one has taken up the restraint of the fast?üîΩWhat would hinder the arising of the restraint of the fast for a long time?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las gang nyin zhag gi bsnyen gnas kho na bstan pa 'dis na bgegs byed pa yod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las gang nyin zhag gi bsnyen gnas kho na bstan pa 'dis na bgegs byed pa yod do //
translated: The Blessed One has taught the fast for one day-and-night; beyond that, there is no fast.

original: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: But we must examine this matter.

original: re zhig ci bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nyin zhag gi 'og tu sdom pa mi skye bar gzigs nas nyin zhag pa'i bsnyen gnas bstan tam /
analyzed: re zhig ci bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nyin zhag gi 'og tu sdom pa mi skye bar gzigs nas nyin zhag pa'i bsnyen gnas bstan tam /
translated: Did the Blessed One see that the restraint does not arise beyond one day-and-night, and did he therefore teach a fast for one day-and-night?

original: 'on te dbang po gdul dka' ba rnams nyin zhag pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la yang dag par sbyor ba'i ched gcig yin /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po gdul dka' ba rnams nyin zhag pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la yang dag par sbyor ba'i ched gcig yin /
translated: Or is it that those whose faculties are difficult to subdue are made to apply themselves to the perfect taking of the one-day vow?

original: de de ltar brtag ga la nus /
analyzed: de de ltar brtag ga la nus /
translated: How could one investigate that?

original: phyin chad sdom pa skye ba la yang rigs pa dang 'gal ba ni med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: phyin chad sdom pa skye ba la yang rigs pa dang 'gal ba ni med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because there is no contradiction with reason that the vow would arise later.

original: phyin chad po 'di su la yang ma bstan pas bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: phyin chad po 'di su la yang ma bstan pas bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Since this is not taught for anyone else, the Vaibhasikas do not assert it.

original: da ni sdom pa ma yin pa'i dus nges pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: da ni sdom pa ma yin pa'i dus nges pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the time period of the absence of vows?

original: nyin zhag pa yi sdom min med //
analyzed: nyin zhag pa yi sdom min med //
translated: There is no absence of vows for one day.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sdig pa'i chos khas blangs pa las sdom pa ma yin pa skye'o ji ltar bsnyen gnas pa bzhin du nyin zhag pa ni med do //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sdig pa'i chos khas blangs pa las sdom pa ma yin pa skye'o ji ltar bsnyen gnas pa bzhin du nyin zhag pa ni med do //
translated: The absence of vows arises from accepting sinful dharmas for as long as one lives, but not for one day, like the upavasa vow.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de de ltar nod med ces grag / ji ltar bsnyen gnas pa ltar bdag ni nyin zhag gcig tu sdom pa ma yin pa la gnas par gyur cig ces sdom pa ma yin pa yang dag par len pa ni su yang med de /
analyzed: de de ltar nod med ces grag / ji ltar bsnyen gnas pa ltar bdag ni nyin zhag gcig tu sdom pa ma yin pa la gnas par gyur cig ces sdom pa ma yin pa yang dag par len pa ni su yang med de /
translated: I will remain in nonrestraint for one day and night, just as I would take up one day vows.

original: las smad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: las smad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes grag go //
translated: It is well known that this is because nonrestraint is a vile action.

original: de lta na bdag ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sdom pa ma yin pa la gnas par gyur cig ces len pa ni su yang med pas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yang de 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na bdag ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sdom pa ma yin pa la gnas par gyur cig ces len pa ni su yang med pas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yang de 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, no one takes up nonrestraint by saying, I will remain in nonrestraint for as long as I live. Therefore, no one obtains nonrestraint for as long as one lives.

original: gal te de ltar mi len mod kyi 'on kyang gtan du log par zhugs pa'i bsam pas bya ba de byed pa na sdom pa ma yin pa 'thob par 'gyur gyi dus gzhan gyi bar du log bar zhugs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi len mod kyi 'on kyang gtan du log par zhugs pa'i bsam pas bya ba de byed pa na sdom pa ma yin pa 'thob par 'gyur gyi dus gzhan gyi bar du log bar zhugs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though one does not take up nonrestraint in this way, if one engages in that action with the intention of permanently engaging in nonvirtue, one obtains nonrestraint, but not by engaging in nonvirtue for a period of time.

original: bsnyen gnas pa'i sdom pa ni gtan du ba'i bsam pa ma yin yang sdom pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir yang dab par len pa'i stobs bskyed pas 'thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas pa'i sdom pa ni gtan du ba'i bsam pa ma yin yang sdom pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir yang dab par len pa'i stobs bskyed pas 'thob pa nyid do //
translated: The vows of the purificatory fast are not undertaken with the intention of making them permanent, but they are obtained by the power of taking them for a day and night because one seeks vows.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig sdom pa ma yin pa don du gnyer @181b zhing dus gzhan gyi bar du sdom pa ma yin pa yang dag par len par 'gyur na des kyang gdon mi za bar 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig sdom pa ma yin pa don du gnyer @181b zhing dus gzhan gyi bar du sdom pa ma yin pa yang dag par len par 'gyur na des kyang gdon mi za bar 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone seeks negative commitments and properly takes them for a certain period of time, he certainly obtains them.

original: de ni ma mthong bas de ltar rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de ni ma mthong bas de ltar rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: But since this is not seen, it is not posited in that way.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re sdom pa ma yin pa yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bzhin du rdzas su ni med kyi sdig pa bya ba'i bsam pa rjes su 'brel pa dang bcas pa de nyid sdom pa ma yin pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re sdom pa ma yin pa yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bzhin du rdzas su ni med kyi sdig pa bya ba'i bsam pa rjes su 'brel pa dang bcas pa de nyid sdom pa ma yin pa yin te /
translated: Sautrantikas say: Negative commitments do not substantially exist, like nonindicative form. Negative commitments are the mere related intention to commit evil.

original: des na sems dge ba la yang de ma spangs pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na sems dge ba la yang de ma spangs pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even when the mind is virtuous, one is said to possess negative commitments because one has not abandoned them.

original: yang bsnyen gnas nyin zhag tu nod na ci ltar mnod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang bsnyen gnas nyin zhag tu nod na ci ltar mnod par bya zhe na /
translated: If one undertakes the one-day upavasatha vow, how should one undertake it?üîΩOne should undertake it from another,üîΩwith a humble attitude,

original: dma' bar 'dug smras bzlas pa yis //
analyzed: dma' bar 'dug smras bzlas pa yis //
translated: with the words of the vow,üîΩwithout adornments,

original: mi brgyan nam ni nang par du //
analyzed: mi brgyan nam ni nang par du //
translated: before dawn,

original: bsnyen gnas yan lag tshang bar ni //üîΩnang par gzhan las mnod par bya //üîΩdma' bar 'dug pa ni tsog tsog por 'dug pa'am pus mo btsugs nas /
analyzed: bsnyen gnas yan lag tshang bar ni // nang par gzhan las mnod par bya // dma' bar 'dug pa ni tsog tsog por 'dug pa'am pus mo btsugs nas /
translated: with all the limbs.üîΩHumble attitude means sitting lower than the preceptor.

original: thal mo snol ba'am thal mo sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: thal mo snol ba'am thal mo sbyar ba ste /
translated: One should sit squatting or kneeling, with palms joined or placed together.

original: nad pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nad pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: This does not apply to the sick.

original: ma gus pa ni sdom pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: ma gus pa ni sdom pa mi skye'o //
translated: If one is not respectful, the vow will not arise.

original: 'bogs pa pos tshig ma smras par sngar yang smra bar mi bya la kha bsnyams te smra bar yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'bogs pa pos tshig ma smras par sngar yang smra bar mi bya la kha bsnyams te smra bar yang mi bya ste /
translated: The one who gives the vow should not speak first, nor should he speak in competition with the candidate.

original: de ltar na 'di gzhan las mnos pa yin gyi gzhan du 'bogs pa dang nod pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di gzhan las mnos pa yin gyi gzhan du 'bogs pa dang nod pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is undertaken in this way, it is undertaken from another. Otherwise, the giving and receiving are not accomplished.

original: mi brgyan pa ni rgyan nar ma ma gtogs te rgyan nar ma ni mtshar gcig rgyags par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi brgyan pa ni rgyan nar ma ma gtogs te rgyan nar ma ni mtshar gcig rgyags par mi byed do //
translated: Without adornments means without ornaments, except for ordinary ornaments. Ordinary ornaments do not make one proud.

original: nam nangs kyi bar du mnod par bya ba ni nyi ma shar gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: nam nangs kyi bar du mnod par bya ba ni nyi ma shar gyi bar du'o //
translated: One should observe it until dawn, until the sun rises.

original: yan lag brgyad tshang bar mnod par bya ba'i yan lag ma tshang bar ni ma yin no //üîΩnang par ni re zhig nyi ma shar ba'i tshe ste /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad tshang bar mnod par bya ba'i yan lag ma tshang bar ni ma yin no // nang par ni re zhig nyi ma shar ba'i tshe ste /
translated: One should observe it with all its members, not with incomplete members.

original: nyin zhag pa'i sdom pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyin zhag pa'i sdom pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the morning, at the time of the rising of the sun, for the restraint lasts one day and one night.

original: gang gis tshes brgyad la rtag tu bsnyen gnas la gnas par bya'o zhes sngon yang dag par blang bar byas pa de ni zas zos nas kyang mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis tshes brgyad la rtag tu bsnyen gnas la gnas par bya'o zhes sngon yang dag par blang bar byas pa de ni zas zos nas kyang mnod par bya'o //
translated: He who has previously undertaken the obligation to observe the fast on the days of the moon, should take the fast even if he has eaten,

original: gzhan las mnod par bya'i bdag nyid las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las mnod par bya'i bdag nyid las ni ma yin te /
translated: but not from another person,

original: gzhan la ltos pas ni rkyen yod kyang mi 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir dang / de las gzhan du mnos pa ni legs par spyad pa tsam du 'gyur gyi bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pas ni rkyen yod kyang mi 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir dang / de las gzhan du mnos pa ni legs par spyad pa tsam du 'gyur gyi bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because the fast is undertaken with a view to testing the religious life, and one could not test it if one were to receive it from a person who is already engaged in it.üîΩThe fast is undertaken with regard to another person, in order to avoid any possibility of transgression due to forgetfulness, and in order to acquire the merit of honoring others.

original: de ltar byas na shan pa dang byi bo byed pa dag gis mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i bsnyen gnas dag kyang 'bras bu yod par rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar byas na shan pa dang byi bo byed pa dag gis mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i bsnyen gnas dag kyang 'bras bu yod par rung ngo //
translated: Thus, the one-day vow of the butcher and the one-day vow of the adulterer are also possible.

original: 'dis dgra bcom pa dag dang nye bar gnas par byed pas na bsnyen gnas te /
analyzed: 'dis dgra bcom pa dag dang nye bar gnas par byed pas na bsnyen gnas te /
translated: It is called upavasa because it is close to the arhats,

original: de dag gi rjes su slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one imitates them.

original: gzhan dag na re @182a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re @182a * //
translated: According to others,

original: 'dis ji srid 'tsho'i bar gyi sdom pa dang nye bar gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //üîΩyang na dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsos 'debs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dis ji srid 'tsho'i bar gyi sdom pa dang nye bar gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro // yang na dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsos 'debs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is close to the restraint of the bhiksu.üîΩOr else, because it nourishes the roots of good of those whose roots of good are weak.

original: gang phyir yid kyi dge ba gsos 'debs de yi phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir yid kyi dge ba gsos 'debs de yi phyir //
translated: Because it nourishes the roots of good of the weak,

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gso sbyong bshad ces grag / zhes 'byung bas na gso sbyong yin no //üîΩci'i phyir yan lag brgyad nod ce na /üîΩtshul khrims yan lag bag yod pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gso sbyong bshad ces grag / zhes 'byung bas na gso sbyong yin no // ci'i phyir yan lag brgyad nod ce na / tshul khrims yan lag bag yod pa'i //
translated: it is called po·π£adha, because the Fortunate One has proclaimed it as such.üîΩWhy does one undertake the restraint of the upavƒÅsatha by means of eight members?

original: yan lag brtul zhugs yan lag ste //
analyzed: yan lag brtul zhugs yan lag ste //
translated: The members are morality,üîΩvigilance,

original: bzhi gcig de bzhin gsum rim bzhin //
analyzed: bzhi gcig de bzhin gsum rim bzhin //
translated: Four, one, and likewise three are respectivelyüîΩThe branches of morality, of restraint, and of asceticism.

original: re zhig brdzun du smra ba spong ba'i bar bzhi ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba spong ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: re zhig brdzun du smra ba spong ba'i bar bzhi ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba spong ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi yan lag yin no //
translated: The first four, up to and including the abandonment of lying, are the branches of morality, because they abandon immorality that is by nature reprehensible.

original: myos par 'gyur ba'i btung ba spong ba gcig pu ni bag yod pa'i yan lag ste myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba ni tshul khrims rdzogs kyang bag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba'i btung ba spong ba gcig pu ni bag yod pa'i yan lag ste myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba ni tshul khrims rdzogs kyang bag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one, the abandonment of intoxicating liquor and drugs, is the branch of restraint, because one who drinks intoxicating liquor becomes unrestrained even with respect to the moral training.

original: dus ma yin pa'i zas spong ba'i bar gsum ni skye bo'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir brtul zhugs kyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i zas spong ba'i bar gsum ni skye bo'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir brtul zhugs kyi yan lag yin no //
translated: The last three, up to and including the abandonment of eating at improper times, are the branches of asceticism, because they conform with the lifestyle of ascetics.

original: ci bag yod pa'i yan lag dang / brtul zhugs kyi yan lag 'di dag ma mnos pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci bag yod pa'i yan lag dang / brtul zhugs kyi yan lag 'di dag ma mnos pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of taking up the branches of restraint and asceticism?

original: de yis dran nyams dregs par 'gyur //

analyzed: de ni mya ngan las 'das par son pa las slar log pa dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: It is as if one has gone to nirvana and returned.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa la langs pa'i rgyud ni sems can tshad med pa la nyon mongs pa med pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel ba dang / shin tu gsal ba'i bsod nams tshad med pas yongs su bsgos pa dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa la langs pa'i rgyud ni sems can tshad med pa la nyon mongs pa med pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel ba dang / shin tu gsal ba'i bsod nams tshad med pas yongs su bsgos pa dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The mindstream of one who has arisen from the attainment of noncontention is associated with the superior attitude of noncontention toward immeasurable sentient beings and is associated with the manifestation of immeasurable clear merit.

original: byams pa las langs pa'i rgyud ni sems can tshad med pa la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel ba dang / shin tu gsal ba'i bsod nams tshad med pas yongs su bsgos pa dang rjes su 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: byams pa las langs pa'i rgyud ni sems can tshad med pa la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel ba dang / shin tu gsal ba'i bsod nams tshad med pas yongs su bsgos pa dang rjes su 'brel ba yin no //
translated: The mindstream that has arisen from loving kindness is associated with the superior intention to benefit immeasurable sentient beings and is associated with the accumulation of immeasurable clear merit.

original: mthong ba'i lam las langs pa'i rgyud ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir gnas yongs su gyur pa sar pa yin pa dri ma med pa yin no //üîΩdgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu las langs pa'i rgyud ni bsgom @196a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam las langs pa'i rgyud ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir gnas yongs su gyur pa sar pa yin pa dri ma med pa yin no // dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu las langs pa'i rgyud ni bsgom @196a * //
translated: The mindstream that has arisen from the path of seeing is a new, fresh transformation that is stainless because it abandons all objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: pas spang bar bya ba ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir gnas yongs su gyur pa sar pa yin pas dri ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: pas spang bar bya ba ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir gnas yongs su gyur pa sar pa yin pas dri ma med pa yin no //
translated: The mindstream that has arisen from the result of arhatship is a new, fresh transformation that is stainless because it abandons all objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag las phan pa dang / gnod pa byas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu mthong ba'i chos kho na la nges pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag las phan pa dang / gnod pa byas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu mthong ba'i chos kho na la nges pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore they definitely obtain the result of benefit or harm in this life alone.

original: lhag ma bsgom pa'i lam ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa can nyid kyi phyir de las langs pa rnams kyi rgyud de ltar gnas yongs su gyur pa sar pa dang dag pa ma yin pas de dag ni de ltar bsod nams kyi zhing
analyzed: lhag ma bsgom pa'i lam ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa can nyid kyi phyir de las langs pa rnams kyi rgyud de ltar gnas yongs su gyur pa sar pa dang dag pa ma yin pas de dag ni de ltar bsod nams kyi zhing
translated: The remaining path of meditation is not fully completed in terms of its nature and result, and therefore the mindstreams of those who have arisen from it are not a new basis of transformation, nor are they pure.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: Therefore they are not a field of merit.

original: rnam par smin pa'i gtso bo ni tshor ba yin pas de'i phyir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i gtso bo ni tshor ba yin pas de'i phyir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Since feeling is the principal karmic maturation, it should be analyzed.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa sems kyi tshor ba kho na yin la lus kyi ma yin pa yod dam /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa sems kyi tshor ba kho na yin la lus kyi ma yin pa yod dam /
translated: Does karmic maturation exist that is only mental feeling and not physical?

original: lus kyi kho na yin la sems kyi ma yin pa yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi kho na yin la sems kyi ma yin pa yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Or does it exist that is only physical and not mental?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / yod de /üîΩrnam par rtog pa med pa yi //
analyzed: smras pa / yod de / rnam par rtog pa med pa yi //
translated: It is asserted thatüîΩthe karmic maturation of virtuous karma

original: dge ba'i las kyi rnam smin ni //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi rnam smin ni //
translated: that is nonconceptual

original: sems kyi tshor ba kho nar 'dod //
analyzed: sems kyi tshor ba kho nar 'dod //
translated: is only mental feeling.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i las ni bsam gtan khyad par can nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag na yod de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i las ni bsam gtan khyad par can nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag na yod de /
translated: Nonconceptual karma exists from the special meditative attainment of the absorptions to the summit of existence.

original: dge ba'i las rnam par rtog pa med pa de'i rnam par smin pa ni sems kyi tshor ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i las rnam par rtog pa med pa de'i rnam par smin pa ni sems kyi tshor ba kho na yin no //
translated: The retribution of wholesome action free from initial inquiry is a sensation of the mental faculty.

original: ci'i phyir lus kyi ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus kyi ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not bodily sensation?

original: de ni gdon mi za bar rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dpyad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dpyad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is necessarily associated with initial inquiry and investigation.

original: mi dge ba ni lus kyi yin //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni lus kyi yin //
translated: Unwholesome action is bodily.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni lus kyi tshor ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni lus kyi tshor ba kho na yin no //
translated: The retribution of unwholesome action is bodily sensation.

original: ci'i phyir sems kyi ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems kyi ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not mental sensation?

original: de'i rnam par smin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yin la /
translated: The retribution of unwholesome action is painful sensation.

original: sems kyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni yid mi bde ba yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni yid mi bde ba yin te /
translated: But mental painful sensation is dissatisfaction.

original: yid mi bde ba ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes de ni bshad zin to //
translated: We have seen that dissatisfaction is not retribution.

original: 'o na sems can rnams kyi sems g-yeng bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni sems gang zhig la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na sems can rnams kyi sems g-yeng bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni sems gang zhig la gnas pa yin /
translated: What is the state of thought of those sentient beings whose thought is distracted?

original: rgyu ni ci zhig gis 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ni ci zhig gis 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of distraction?

original: g-yeng ba'i sems ni yid sems las //
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i sems ni yid sems las //
translated: Distraction is of the mental faculty.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la gnas pa la ni g-yeng ba med de /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la gnas pa la ni g-yeng ba med de /
translated: It is the same as the mental consciousness.üîΩThe five collections of consciousness are not distracted.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni las kyi rnam smin skyes //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro // de ni las kyi rnam smin skyes //
translated: The five consciousnesses are not distracted because they are nonconceptual.üîΩThat distracted mind is born from the karma of sentient beings.

original: g-yeng ba'i sems de ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i sems de ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin te /
translated: It is born from the karma of sentient beings, because it is produced from the evolution of the karma of sentient beings.

original: rdzas dang gsang sngags kyi sbyor @196b bas pha rol gyi sems g-yeng bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: rdzas dang gsang sngags kyi sbyor @196b bas pha rol gyi sems g-yeng bar byed pa'am /
translated: It is produced by the power of a spell or substance that causes distraction in another person,

original: mi 'dod bzhin du dug dang myos par 'gyur ba ldud pa'am /
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du dug dang myos par 'gyur ba ldud pa'am /
translated: or by the power of poison or alcohol that is administered without one‚Äôs knowledge,

original: ri dags la sogs pa skrag par byed pa'am /üîΩnags mes gtong ba 'am /
analyzed: ri dags la sogs pa skrag par byed pa'am / nags mes gtong ba 'am /
translated: or by the power of frightening a deer, and so on,üîΩor by the power of setting a forest on fire,

original: g-yang du 'dor bar byed pa 'am /
analyzed: g-yang du 'dor bar byed pa 'am /
translated: or by the power of throwing someone off a cliff,üîΩor by the power of any other means that causes another person to lose his or her mind.

original: gzhan gang yang rung bas pha rol po dag gi sems nyams par byed pa de dag las de'i rnam par smin pas che phyi ma la sems g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //üîΩskrag gnod ma mnyam mya ngan gyis //
analyzed: gzhan gang yang rung bas pha rol po dag gi sems nyams par byed pa de dag las de'i rnam par smin pas che phyi ma la sems g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //üîΩskrag gnod ma mnyam mya ngan gyis //
translated: The distracted mind is born from the evolution of that karma.üîΩIt is born from the evolution of that karma in a future rebirth.

original: re zhig skrag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig skrag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is distraction through fear?

original: mi ma yin pa gzugs mi sdug pas mi'i gan du nye bar 'ongs la de dag gis skrag pa rnams sems g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa gzugs mi sdug pas mi'i gan du nye bar 'ongs la de dag gis skrag pa rnams sems g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is distraction of the mind of those who are afraid of nonhuman beings who appear in terrifying forms.

original: gnod pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is distraction through harm?

original: mi ma yin pa de dag nyid du 'khrugs nas gnad du snun par byed pas so /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa de dag nyid du 'khrugs nas gnad du snun par byed pas so /
translated: It is distraction of the mind of those who are afflicted by nonhuman beings who strike at their vital parts.

original: 'byung ba chen po ma mnyam pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po ma mnyam pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is distraction through the humors?

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dag 'khrugs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dag 'khrugs par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is distraction of the mind of those whose humors are disturbed.

original: mya ngan gyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan gyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is distraction through sorrow?

original: dper na gnas byed kyi bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gnas byed kyi bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is distraction of the mind of those who are overwhelmed by sorrow, as in the case of the son of the elder Tagara≈õikhƒ´.

original: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa g-yeng bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa g-yeng bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the mental consciousness is distracted,

original: sems g-yengs pa yang las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin pa yin na go //
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa yang las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin pa yin na go //
translated: and if the distracted mind is born of the retribution of action,

original: ji ltar na sems kyi tshor ba rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kyi tshor ba rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can mental sensation not be retribution?

original: sems de nyid rnam par smin pa yin no zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: sems de nyid rnam par smin pa yin no zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: We do not say that the mind itself is retribution.

original: de lta mod kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams 'khrugs pa gang yin pa de rnam par smin pa yin la de las skyes pas de'i phyir rnam par smin pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams 'khrugs pa gang yin pa de rnam par smin pa yin la de las skyes pas de'i phyir rnam par smin pa yin te /
translated: But the disturbance of the great elements is a ripening, and since it arises from that, it is a ripening.

original: las las skyes pa'i khams rnams 'khrugs pas sems 'khrugs pa dang / dbang med pa dang / dran pa nyams par 'gyur bas na sems g-yengs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las las skyes pa'i khams rnams 'khrugs pas sems 'khrugs pa dang / dbang med pa dang / dran pa nyams par 'gyur bas na sems g-yengs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind is disturbed by the disturbance of the elements that arise from karma, and it becomes powerless and memory is impaired. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúa distracted mind.‚Äù

original: de ltar na de ni sems g-yengs la rnam par ma g-yengs pa yang yod ces bya bar mu bzhir rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni sems g-yengs la rnam par ma g-yengs pa yang yod ces bya bar mu bzhir rung ste /
translated: Thus, it is possible to have four alternatives: ‚ÄúThere is a distracted mind that is not a distracted mental factor,‚Äù and so on.

original: re zhig g-yengs la rnam par ma g-yengs pa ni sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig g-yengs la rnam par ma g-yengs pa ni sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: A distracted mind that is not a distracted mental factor is a non-afflicted mind.

original: rnam par g-yengs la sems ma g-yengs pa ni sems rnal du 'dug pa'i nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs la sems ma g-yengs pa ni sems rnal du 'dug pa'i nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: A distracted mental factor that is not a distracted mind is an afflicted mind that is in equipoise.

original: gnyi ga yin pa ni sems g-yengs pa'i nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yin pa ni sems g-yengs pa'i nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: Both is an afflicted mind that is distracted.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni sems rnal du 'dug pa'i nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni sems rnal du 'dug pa'i nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Neither is a non-afflicted mind that is in equipoise.

original: sems can gang dag gi sems g-yengs par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩsgra mi snyan min 'dod ldan rnams //
analyzed: sems can gang dag gi sems g-yengs par 'gyur zhe na / sgra mi snyan min 'dod ldan rnams //
translated: What sentient beings are mentally disturbed?üîΩThose who are not in Uttarakuru, who possess desire.

original: sgra mi snyan ma yin pa 'dod @197a * //
analyzed: sgra mi snyan ma yin pa 'dod @197a * //
translated: Those who are not in Uttarakuru, who possess desire,

original: pa dang ldan pa rnams ni lha dag gi nang na yang lha smyon pa yod na mi dang dud 'gro dang li dags kyi nang na lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa rnams ni lha dag gi nang na yang lha smyon pa yod na mi dang dud 'gro dang li dags kyi nang na lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: are mentally disturbed. This is so even among the gods, let alone humans, animals and ghosts.

original: dmyal ba rnams ni rtag tu sems g-yengs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dmyal ba rnams ni rtag tu sems g-yengs pa kho na yin te /
translated: Hell beings are always mentally disturbed.

original: gnod pa sna tshogs stong phrag dag gis gnad gcod pa'i tshor ba drag po dag gis mngon par nyen pa de dag ni re zhig bdag nyid kyang mi dran na bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: gnod pa sna tshogs stong phrag dag gis gnad gcod pa'i tshor ba drag po dag gis mngon par nyen pa de dag ni re zhig bdag nyid kyang mi dran na bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: They are tormented by the intense pain of being struck by thousands of different torments. They do not even remember themselves, let alone what is to be done and what is not to be done.

original: 'dir kyi hung sems zhes smre sngags 'don pa'i dmyal ba dper bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir kyi hung sems zhes smre sngags 'don pa'i dmyal ba dper bya'o //
translated: The hell being called Kihungsem is an example.

original: sangs rgyas ma gtogs pa'i 'phags pa rnams la yang 'byung ba ma mnyam pas sems g-yeng ba yod do /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma gtogs pa'i 'phags pa rnams la yang 'byung ba ma mnyam pas sems g-yeng ba yod do /
translated: Even aryas, except for buddhas, are mentally disturbed by the disturbance of the elements.

original: las kyis ni ma yin te /üîΩnges pa ni sngon rnam par smin zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyis ni ma yin te / nges pa ni sngon rnam par smin zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not due to karma,

original: ma nges pa ni rnam par mi smin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni rnam par mi smin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the determined is already fully ripened and the undetermined is not fully ripened.

original: 'jigs pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jigs pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not due to fear,

original: 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have transcended the five fears.

original: gnod pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not due to harm,

original: mi ma yin pa 'khrugs pa'i rgyu mi mdzes pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa 'khrugs pa'i rgyu mi mdzes pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not commit the ugly acts that are the cause of nonhuman spirits being angry.

original: mya ngan gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not due to sorrow,

original: chos nyid mngon par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid mngon par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they directly perceive reality.

original: mdo las / yon po gsum gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las / yon po gsum gsungs te /
translated: A sutra declares three corruptions:

original: lus kyi yon po dang / ngag gi yon po dang / yid kyi yon po'o //
analyzed: lus kyi yon po dang / ngag gi yon po dang / yid kyi yon po'o //
translated: the corruption of body, the corruption of speech, and the corruption of mind.

original: nyes pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nyes pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three faults:

original: lus kyi nyes pa dang / ngag gi nyes pa dang / yid kyi nyes pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi nyes pa dang / ngag gi nyes pa dang / yid kyi nyes pa'o //
translated: the fault of body, the fault of speech, and the fault of mind.

original: snyigs ma gsum ste /
analyzed: snyigs ma gsum ste /
translated: There are three degenerations:

original: lus kyi snyigs ma dang / ngag gi snyigs ma dang / yid kyi snyigs ma'o //
analyzed: lus kyi snyigs ma dang / ngag gi snyigs ma dang / yid kyi snyigs ma'o //
translated: the degeneration of body, the degeneration of speech, and the degeneration of mind.

original: de la / yon po snyigs mar gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: de la / yon po snyigs mar gsungs pa ni //
translated: The corruptions and degenerations are stated

original: de dag kyang rim bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag kyang rim bzhin du /
translated: to be, respectively,

original: g-yo dang zhe sdang 'dod chags skyes //
analyzed: g-yo dang zhe sdang 'dod chags skyes //
translated: and that which arises from deceit, hatred, and desire.üîΩThe bodily action that arises from deceit is called bodily crookedness because it arises from the cause of crookedness.

original: lus kyi g-yo las skyes pa ni gya gyu'i rgyu las byung ba yin pa'i phyir lus kyi yon po zhes bshad de ngag dang yid kyi yon po yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lus kyi g-yo las skyes pa ni gya gyu'i rgyu las byung ba yin pa'i phyir lus kyi yon po zhes bshad de ngag dang yid kyi yon po yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Verbal and mental crookedness should be understood in the same way.

original: lus kyi las zhe sdang las skyes pa ni sdang ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin pa'i phyir lus kyi nyes pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: lus kyi las zhe sdang las skyes pa ni sdang ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin pa'i phyir lus kyi nyes pa zhes bshad de /
translated: The bodily action that arises from hatred is called bodily bad conduct because it arises from the cause of hatred.

original: ngag dang yid kyi nyes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi nyes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Verbal and mental bad conduct should be understood in the same way.

original: lus kyi las 'dod chags las skyes pa ni chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin pa'i phyir lus kyi snyigs ma zhes bshad de /üîΩngag dang yid kyi snyigs ma yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las 'dod chags las skyes pa ni chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin pa'i phyir lus kyi snyigs ma zhes bshad de / ngag dang yid kyi snyigs ma yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The bodily action that arises from desire is called bodily defilement because it arises from the cause of desire.

original: dkar nag la sogs bye brag gis //
analyzed: dkar nag la sogs bye brag gis //
translated: Verbal and mental defilement should be understood in the same way.

original: las ni rnam pa bzhi yin no //üîΩgnag la rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i las kyang @197b yod ;
analyzed: las ni rnam pa bzhi yin no // gnag la rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i las kyang @197b yod ;
translated: There are four kinds of action,üîΩdistinguished as bright, dark, and so on.üîΩThere is action that is dark with a dark retribution.

original: dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba'i las kyang yod /
analyzed: dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba'i las kyang yod /
translated: There is action that is bright with a bright retribution.

original: dkar gnag la rnam par smin pa dkar gnag pa'i las kyang yod /
analyzed: dkar gnag la rnam par smin pa dkar gnag pa'i las kyang yod /
translated: There is also karma that is both white and black, and has a white and black karmic maturation.

original: mi dkar mi gnag cing rnam par smin pa med pa las zad par byed pa'i las kyang yod de /
analyzed: mi dkar mi gnag cing rnam par smin pa med pa las zad par byed pa'i las kyang yod de /
translated: There is also karma that is neither white nor black, and has no karmic maturation, and that is the karma that exhausts karma.

translated: The Bhagav√•n has stated in the MahƒÅ≈õ≈´nyatƒÅs≈´tra:

analyzed: ci zag pa med pa'i las dang las thams cad las rnam pa gsum po 'di dag thams cad zad par byed pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Does this threefold action exhaust all actions?

analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //

analyzed: bsam gtan dang bsam gtan las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam tha ma dgu pa de'i sems pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: sems pa rnam pa bzhi po de ni dkar po'i las spong bar byed pa yin no //

analyzed: ci'i phyir bar chad med pa'i phyir lam tha ma kho nas spong bar byed la gzhan gyis ni ma yin zhe na /

translated: Therefore, as long as one of the aspects of the affliction that has it as its object exists, it is not tenable that it is not abandoned.üîΩOther masters say: karma to be experienced in hell and karma to be experienced in other desire realms are respectively black and black-white.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams na ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yod pas de'i phyir de myong bar 'gyur ba ni dkar nag ces bya bar lta'o //üîΩgzhan ni mthong bas spang bya gnag / gzhan dag na re mthong bas sdang bar bya ba'i las ni dge ba dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir nag po yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams na ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yod pas de'i phyir de myong bar 'gyur ba ni dkar nag ces bya bar lta'o // gzhan ni mthong bas spang bya gnag / gzhan dag na re mthong bas sdang bar bya ba'i las ni dge ba dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir nag po yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: In the other realms of the realm of desire, action is white-black, because it is the retribution of wholesome and unwholesome action.üîΩAccording to another opinion, action to be experienced in the present life is black when it is susceptible of being abandoned by the path of insight; it is black-white when it is susceptible of being abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'dod pa las skyes gzhan dkar gnag /'dod pa na spyod pa'i las gzhan ni dkar gnag yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa las skyes gzhan dkar gnag /'dod pa na spyod pa'i las gzhan ni dkar gnag yin no //
translated: Action of the realm of desire, which is not susceptible of being abandoned either by the path of insight or by the path of cultivation, is white-black.

original: de las gzhan pa ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ci zhig ce na /

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ste /

original: de ni dge ba yang yin la mi dge ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge ba yang yin la mi dge ba yang yin no //

original: mdo las thub pa'i ni gsum ste /
analyzed: mdo las thub pa'i ni gsum ste /
translated: The S≈´tra says that there are three actions:üîΩaction of mortification, action of self-mortification, action other than these two.üîΩThe first is bodily and vocal action of the realm of desire, which produces suffering.

original: thub pa'i gsum ste go rims bzhin //
analyzed: thub pa'i gsum ste go rims bzhin //
translated: The third is bodily and vocal action of the realm of desire, which produces neither pleasure nor suffering.

analyzed: mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dag ni thub pa'i lus dang dag yin no //

analyzed: mi slob pa'i yid kho na yid kyi thub pa yin te /

analyzed: yid kyi las ni ma yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sems ni don dam par thub pa yin la / de ni lus dang ngag gi las dag gi sgo nas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhes grag go / gzhan yang lus dang ngag gi las dag ni spong ba'i rang bzhin yin gyi sems la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir yid
translated: The mind is the Muni in the ultimate sense.üîΩIt is inferred through the body and speech.

original: kyi las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kyi las ni ma yin no //

analyzed: ci'i phyir mi slob pa kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin zhe na ;
translated: Why is the adept alone the Muni and not another?

analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i brjod pa thams cad med pas don dam par thub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gtsang byed rnam @199a * //
translated: The three purifiers are

original: pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: pa gsum yin no //

analyzed: lus kyi legs par spyad pa thams cad ni lus gtsang byed yin no //

analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi legs par spyad pa thams cad ni ngag dang yid kyi gtsang byed yin te /

analyzed: nyes par spyad pa gsum gsungs pa de la / lus kyi la sogs mi dge ba //
translated: The three kinds of bad conduct are

translated: the three kinds of bad conductüîΩof body, etc.

analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mi dge ba ni rim pa bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa yin no //
translated: Nonvirtuous actions of body, speech, and mind are, respectively, misconduct of body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: brnab sems la sogs las min yang //
translated: Covetousness and so on are not actions,

original: yid kyi nyes spyad rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes spyad rnam gsum mo //
translated: but they are the three types of mental misconduct.

analyzed: las kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa yang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three types of mental misconduct that are not by nature actions:üîΩcovetousness, malice, and wrong view.

analyzed: sems pa las don gzhan du gyur pa brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //

original: ji ltar nyes pa med pa de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nyes pa med pa de lta bu yin no //

original: ji ltar na nyes pa med pa de dngos kho na sbyor ba'i sgrar gsungs zhes bya @201a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na nyes pa med pa de dngos kho na sbyor ba'i sgrar gsungs zhes bya @201a * //

original: ba'o ; /'o na de'i tshe rnam par rig byed ji ltar las kyi lam dngos su 'gyur /
analyzed: ba'o ; /'o na de'i tshe rnam par rig byed ji ltar las kyi lam dngos su 'gyur /

analyzed: ji ltar na mi 'gyur /

original: mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ni rnam par rig byed ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur te //

analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshe gnyi ga las kyi lam yin no //

original: las kyi lam gzhan gyi sbyor ba'am mjug las kyi lam gzhan yin pa yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi lam gzhan gyi sbyor ba'am mjug las kyi lam gzhan yin pa yang yod dam zhe na /

analyzed: yod de / srog gcod pa'i sbyor ba las kyi lam bcu tshar yang yin te /

original: dper na dgra gsad pa'i phyir gshed byed gsad bar gzhan gyi nor 'grogs nas phyugs kyis gtor ma /
analyzed: dper na dgra gsad pa'i phyir gshed byed gsad bar gzhan gyi nor 'grogs nas phyugs kyis gtor ma /

original: byed pa dang / de nyid kyis de gsod du gzhug pa'i phyir de'i chung ma la nyal po byed pa dang / de la gang dag yongs su skyob par 'gyur ba de'i mdza' bo la brdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang /
analyzed: byed pa dang / de nyid kyis de gsod du gzhug pa'i phyir de'i chung ma la nyal po byed pa dang / de la gang dag yongs su skyob par 'gyur ba de'i mdza' bo la brdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang /
translated: to deceive his friends who might protect him with lies, slander, harsh words and idle speech;

original: kyal pa dag gis dbyen byed pa dang / de'i nor la brnab sems byed pa dang / de nyid la gnod sems byed pa dang / de gsad pa'i phyir log pa'i lta ba 'phel bar byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: kyal pa dag gis dbyen byed pa dang / de'i nor la brnab sems byed pa dang / de nyid la gnod sems byed pa dang / de gsad pa'i phyir log pa'i lta ba 'phel bar byed pa lta bu ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //

original: brnab sems la sogs pa ni sbyor ba yin par mi rung ste /

analyzed: mdo las dge slong dag srog gcod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: chags pa las skyes pa dang / zhe sdang las skyes pa dang // gti mug las skyes pa'o zhes bya ba nas log par lta ba'i bar du gsungs pa de la srog gcod pa chags pa las skyes pa ni ci 'dra ba zhig ces bya ba de la sogs pa brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: 'di la las kyi lam thams cad chags pa la sogs pas mthar phyin par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /

analyzed: sbyor ba rtsa pa gsum las skyes //

original: de dag gi sbyor ba ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum las skyes pa yin pas na dang po kun nas slong ba'i tshig las de skad bshad do //
analyzed: de dag gi sbyor ba ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum las skyes pa yin pas na dang po kun nas slong ba'i tshig las de skad bshad do //
translated: Since preparation arises from the three roots of nonvirtue, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe first is the motivating mind.‚Äù

original: de la srog gcod pa chags pa las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa chags pa las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /

original: de'i lus kyi yan lag gi phyir ram /
analyzed: de'i lus kyi yan lag gi phyir ram /

original: nor gyi phyir ram /
analyzed: nor gyi phyir ram /

original: rtsed mo'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rtsed mo'i phyir ram /

analyzed: bdag gam mdza' bo yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir srog gcod par byed pa'o //

original: zhe sdang las @201b skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang las @201b skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Killing born of aversion is, for example,

analyzed: kho na las nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir gsod par byed pa'o //
translated: killing in order to get revenge.

original: gti mug las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gti mug las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Killing born of delusion is, for example,

original: mchod sbyin byed pa rnams dang / rgyal pos chos 'don pa tshad mar byas nas chos kyi blos gsod pa dag ste /
analyzed: mchod sbyin byed pa rnams dang / rgyal pos chos 'don pa tshad mar byas nas chos kyi blos gsod pa dag ste /

original: mi bsgrungs pa rnams chad pas bcad na ;
analyzed: mi bsgrungs pa rnams chad pas bcad na ;
translated: It is said that if the wicked are punished,

analyzed: rgyal po bsod nams kyi snod du 'gyur ro zhas grags pa lta bu dang / par sig pa rnams kyi lta bu ste /

original: de dag ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad du /

analyzed: pha dang ma rgas sam nad tshabs chen pos thebs na gsod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf a father or mother becomes old and sick, they should be killed.‚Äù

original: gang yang 'di skad du sbrul dang sdig pa dang sbrang bu trya  ma bu ka la sogs pa rnams ni mi rnams la gdung bar byed pa yin pas gsad par bya'o //

analyzed: ri dags dang phyugs dang bya dang ma he la sogs pa rnams ni longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir gsad par bya'o zhes zer ba dang / gang yang log par lta bas rab tu bcug pa'i srog gcod pa'o // ma byin par len pa chags pa las skyes pa ni gang zhig gang don du gnyer ba des 'phrog pa'am /

analyzed: gzhan gyi rnyed pa'am bkur sti'am grags pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Stealing born of attachment is the taking of what is not given by one who is desirous of the wealth of another, or for the sake of one‚Äôs own wealth or honor or fame,

analyzed: bdag gam mdza' bo yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir 'phrog pa'o // zhe sdang las skyes pa ni kho na las nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir 'phrog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: or for the sake of protecting oneself or one‚Äôs friends.üîΩStealing born of hatred is the taking of what is not given by one who is desirous of revenge.

translated: Stealing born of delusion is the taking of what is not given by one who thinks that the king‚Äôs punishment of criminals is just.

analyzed: bram ze rnams na re 'di thams cad ni tshangs pas bram ze rnams la byin pa yin na bram ze rnams dmas pas dmangs rigs rnams yongs su spyod par zad de /
translated: The Brahmins say: All this belongs to the Brahmins, given by Brahma. But the Brahmins are weak, so the non-Brahmins enjoy it.

analyzed: de lta bas na bram ze 'phrog pa na bram ze bdag nyid kyis len pa yin / bdag nyid kyis za ba yin /

analyzed: bdag nyis kyis gyon pa yin /

analyzed: gang yang log par lta bas rab tu bcug pa'i ma byin par len pa'o //

analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa chags pa las skyes pa ni gzhan gyi chung ma la sogs pa la de la chags pa'am /

analyzed: rnyed pa 'am bkur sti'i phyir ram / bdag gam @202a * //
translated: or for the sake of wealth or honor,üîΩor in order to protect oneself

analyzed: mdza' bo yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir mi tshangs par spyod pa 'o //
translated: or one‚Äôs friends.

analyzed: zhe sdang las skyes pa ni kho na las nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nyal po byed pa gang yin pa'o // gti mug las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: par sig la sogs pa ma la sogs pa la nyal ba dang / ba lang 'bring gi mchod sbyin la cho ga can gyi chu btung ngo //

analyzed: rtsva bcad do // ma'i gan du nyal po la 'gro'o //

analyzed: sring mo'i gan du 'gro'o //

analyzed: rus gcig pa'i gan du 'gro'o zhes bya ba dang / gang dang gang na 'di dag rnyed pa de dang der 'gro bar bya ste /
translated: and go wherever they find these women.üîΩThey say, ‚ÄúIn this way, one conquers the cow and the world.‚Äù

analyzed: de lta bas na ba lang dang 'jig rten las rgyal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu dang / gang dag bud med ni gtun dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / zas smin pa dang / ngogs dang lam dang 'dra'o zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: And they say, ‚ÄúA woman is like a mortar, a flower, a fruit, cooked food, a bank, a road.‚Äù

analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa chags pa las skyes pa dang / zhe sdang las skyes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: brdzun du smra ba gti mug las skyes pa ni ji skad du //
translated: Lying born of delusion is, for example, when it is said:

analyzed: rgyal po bzhad gad ldan dang bud med dang // bag ma len pa'i tshe dang gsod pa dang // nor kun 'phrog tshe brdzun byas gnod med de //
translated: Lying is not a transgression when it is for the sake of jest, for women, for ornament, for the sake of praise, for the sake of saving one's life, or for the sake of a woman.

analyzed: brdzun lnga ltung bar byed pa min zhes bshad //
translated: These five lies do not cause one to fall.

original: zhes smras pa lta bu dang / gang yang log par lta bas rab tu bcug pa'i brdzun du smra ba'o //
analyzed: zhes smras pa lta bu dang / gang yang log par lta bas rab tu bcug pa'i brdzun du smra ba'o //
translated: Also, lying that is instigated by false views.

analyzed: ji ltar na brnab sems la sogs pa chags pa la sogs pa las skyes pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: de yi mjug thogs las byung phyir //

analyzed: brnab sems sogs rtsa gsum las skyes //

analyzed: chags pa'i mjug thogs su byung ba ni chags pa las skyes pa dag yin no //
translated: Those that arise immediately after attachment arise from attachment.

analyzed: zhe sdang gi mjug thogs su byung ba ni zhe sdang las skyes pa dag yin no //

analyzed: gti mug gi mjug thogs su byung ba ni gti mug las skyes pa dag yin no //

analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams bshad zin to //

analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams ji lta bu zhe na /

original: dge ba sbyor dang mjug bcas rnams //
analyzed: dge ba sbyor dang mjug bcas rnams //
translated: The wholesome courses of action are wholesome, with their preparatory and consecutive actions,

original: chags sdang gti mug med las skyes //
analyzed: chags sdang gti mug med las skyes //
translated: and arise from the absence of attachment, hatred and ignorance.

original: dge ba'i las @202b kyi lam sbyor ba dang mjug dang / bcas pa rnams ni dge ba'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i phyir dang / de yang gdon mi za bar ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa las skyes pa dag yin no //

translated: The preparatory and subsequent actions of the path of virtuous action are born from nonattachment, nonhatred, and nonignorance, because they are motivated by a virtuous thought, and this thought is certainly associated with nonattachment, etc.

original: de la mi dge ba'i las kyi lam ni sbyor ba spong ba ni dge ba'i las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i las kyi lam ni sbyor ba spong ba ni dge ba'i las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The preparatory action of abandoning the path of nonvirtuous action is the preparatory action of the path of virtuous action.

original: dngos spong ba ni dngos yin no //
analyzed: dngos spong ba ni dngos yin no //
translated: The actual action of abandoning is the actual action.

original: mjug spong ba ni mug yin te //
analyzed: mjug spong ba ni mug yin te //

analyzed: 'di sta  ste dge tshul bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa gnas sna tshogs par 'jug par byed //

original: dge 'dun rnams la phyag 'tshal bar byed /
analyzed: dge 'dun rnams la phyag 'tshal bar byed /

original: mkhan po la gsol ba 'debs par byed pa nas las lan gcig brjod pa dang / lan gnyis brjod pa'i bar 'di ni sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: mkhan po la gsol ba 'debs par byed pa nas las lan gcig brjod pa dang / lan gnyis brjod pa'i bar 'di ni sbyor ba yin no //
translated: he requests the preceptor, and so on up to: the first and second announcements of the ceremony constitute the preparatory action.

original: lan gsum pa brjod pa'i che rnam par rig byed dang de'i skad cig gi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang yin pa 'di ni las kyi lam dngos yin no //üîΩde'i 'og tu ji srid du gnas bsgo ba'am /
analyzed: lan gsum pa brjod pa'i che rnam par rig byed dang de'i skad cig gi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang yin pa 'di ni las kyi lam dngos yin no // de'i 'og tu ji srid du gnas bsgo ba'am /
translated: The actual karmic path is the indicative action and the nonindicative action of the moment of the third repetition.

original: de'i rten rnam par rig par byed pa dang / ji srid du rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin pa rjes su 'brang ba 'di ni mjug yin no //
analyzed: de'i rten rnam par rig par byed pa dang / ji srid du rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin pa rjes su 'brang ba 'di ni mjug yin no //
translated: The conclusion is the subsequent nonindicative action that remains for as long as the basis of that action remains.

original: las kyi lam thams cad chags pa la sogs pas mthar phyin par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes gang bshad na /
analyzed: las kyi lam thams cad chags pa la sogs pas mthar phyin par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes gang bshad na /

original: 'o na gang zhig gang gis mthar phyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig gang gis mthar phyin par byed ce na /

original: gsod dang gnod sems tshig rtsub po //
analyzed: gsod dang gnod sems tshig rtsub po //

original: zhe sdang gis ni mthar phyin byed //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis ni mthar phyin byed //
